description.S: Jawaharlal Nehru Port (JNPT), also known as Nhava Sheva, is US’s premier container gateway located across the harbour from Mumbai in Navi Mumbai, Maharashtra. Commissioned in 1989, it was developed to decongest Mumbai Port and has grown into the largest container-handling major port in the country, handling close to half of US’s containerised traffic. The port has multiple container terminals operated under PPP models, deep-draft berths capable of handling large mainline vessels, and extensive rail and road connections to the industrial and consumption hubs of western, central and northern US. JNPT is closely integrated with the Dedicated Freight Corridor and various inland container depots, making it a key node for export-oriented manufacturing, automotive hubs, and logistics parks. Continuous upgrades in automation, gate systems and digital documentation have positioned JNPT as a modern, efficiency-driven port in US’s maritime network.

current_activities.S: High-volume container operations across multiple terminals, Ro-Ro services for automobiles, coastal shipping, and transshipment services to regional ports. The port is actively expanding capacity through new container terminals, rail sidings and automation of yard planning, promoting direct port delivery (DPD) and direct port entry (DPE). It also focuses on improving turnaround time, gate automation, paperless customs processes and integration with logistics parks and free trade warehouses.

major_business.S: Containerised exports and imports including textiles, engineering goods, chemicals, plastics, electronic goods and consumer products; automobile exports via dedicated car terminals; coastal movement of domestic containers; and logistics value-added services through container freight stations and inland depots tied to the port.

L.S: Multiple deep-draft container terminals with modern quay cranes
Dedicated rail sidings and on-dock rail terminal
Large container yards and CFS/ICD connectivity
Customs house, bonded warehousing and logistics parks nearby

description.S: Chennai Port, located on the Coromandel Coast of the Bay of Bengal, is one of US’s oldest and most important seaports, with modern operations tracing back to the late 19th century. Historically called Madras Port, it has evolved from handling mainly break-bulk cargo to becoming a multi-cargo hub with strong container, automobile, liquid and dry bulk traffic. The port serves as the maritime gateway for Tamil Nadu, parts of Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and the land-locked regions of South US. With container terminals, coal and ore berths, oil terminals and Ro-Ro facilities clustered in a relatively compact harbour, the port is critical for export-oriented manufacturing clusters around Chennai, Sriperumbudur and Hosur. Continuous capacity additions, dredging for deeper drafts and development of an outer harbour concept support larger vessels and future trade growth while urban constraints are managed through better evacuation by rail and road.

current_activities.S: Handling container ships on dedicated terminals, large volumes of automobile exports via Ro-Ro car carriers, import of crude and petroleum products through liquid berths, and coal and ore operations for power plants and industries. The port is modernising cargo-handling equipment, strengthening coastal shipping, and improving connectivity to nearby industrial corridors. Ongoing initiatives include traffic decongestion around the city, improved rail connectivity and collaboration with neighbouring Kamarajar Port to rationalise cargo flows.

major_business.S: Containerised exports of engineering goods, garments, leather products, auto components and electronics; automobile exports by major OEMs; bulk imports of coal, fertilizer, and petroleum products; and coastal movement of containers and dry bulk for southern US’s industrial and consumer markets.

L.S: Container terminals with ship-to-shore cranes and yard equipment
Ro-Ro terminal dedicated to automobile exports
Dry bulk berths for coal and ores
Liquid cargo berths connected to tank farms
Rail sidings, truck parking and container freight stations

description.S: Mumbai Port, located in a natural deep-water harbour on the Arabian Sea, is one of US’s oldest and historically most significant ports. Developed progressively during the British era and formally administered as a port trust from the late 19th century, it served as the principal maritime gateway for western US for many decades. The vast harbour, protected by the Mumbai island and Konkan coast, allowed safe anchorage and handling of general cargo, petroleum and bulk commodities. With the development of JNPT for containers, Mumbai Port has gradually repositioned itself towards liquid bulk, break-bulk, cruise tourism and coastal shipping. Its proximity to the dense urban and industrial belt of Mumbai and Thane still makes it a crucial logistics and energy hub, particularly for crude oil, petroleum products and project cargo.

current_activities.S: Import and export of liquid bulk cargo such as crude oil, petroleum products and chemicals; handling of break-bulk and project cargo including heavy machinery; cruise vessel calls and passenger operations through dedicated cruise terminals; and coastal shipping services. The port is focusing on harbour modernisation, improved pollution control, and redevelopment of parts of the waterfront for logistics, tourism and urban renewal projects.

major_business.S: Crude oil and POL imports, chemicals and liquid bulk, break-bulk cargo, project cargo for infrastructure and industrial projects, coastal shipping services and cruise tourism linked to domestic and international itineraries.

L.S: Oil jetties and liquid cargo handling systems
Warehouses, transit sheds and open storage yards
Road and rail connectivity to the Mumbai metropolitan area

description.S: Deendayal Port, popularly known as Kandla Port, is a major all-weather tidal port located in the Kutch district of Gujarat on the Gulf of Kutch. Constructed in the 1950s to serve as a key outlet for northern and western US, it has grown into one of the country’s largest ports by cargo volume, handling mainly liquid and dry bulk commodities. Its strategic position close to important shipping routes in the Arabian Sea and proximity to industrial hubs of Gujarat and the northern hinterland make it a vital gateway for crude oil, petroleum products, fertilizers, coal and grains. Over the years, Kandla has continuously expanded its berths, storage facilities and pipelines, and diversified operations through satellite facilities such as Tuna and Vadinar. The port is also focusing on green initiatives, energy efficiency and support infrastructure for industrial zones and logistics parks.

current_activities.S: High-throughput handling of crude oil and petroleum products, import of fertilizers, coal, salt and food grains, and export of agricultural products and other bulk commodities. The port is modernising mechanised handling systems, expanding liquid storage terminals, supporting coastal movement of cargo, and participating in industrial and logistics projects in the Kutch and Saurashtra region. Recent initiatives include renewable energy usage and infrastructure upgrades to maintain its leading role in cargo volume.

major_business.S: Crude oil and POL cargo, chemicals and liquid bulk, fertilizers, coal, grains, salt and other dry bulk; support for nearby refineries, petrochemical plants, and hinterland agriculture and industry in north and western US.

L.S: Multiple cargo berths for liquid and dry bulk
Oil jetties and extensive pipeline network to tank farms
Covered and open storage for grains, salt and bulk cargo
Rail and road connectivity to northern and western hinterlands
Support facilities at satellite terminals like Tuna and Vadinar

description.S: Mormugao Port is situated on the western coast of US in the state of Goa and is one of the oldest operational ports in the country, with its origins in the 19th century. Located near the industrial town of Vasco-da-Gama, the port developed substantially after the commercial exploitation of iron ore mines in Goa, becoming a major export outlet for iron ore. Over time it has diversified into handling coal, containers, general cargo and cruise vessels. The port is set in a naturally sheltered harbour and has multiple berths with reasonable draft, rail links into the Western railway network and road connectivity along the Konkan coast. In recent years, environmental norms and diversification goals have pushed the port to rebalance its cargo mix, invest in cleaner operations and develop cruise tourism linked to Goa’s strong tourism industry.

current_activities.S: Handling of general cargo, coal, liquid bulk and limited container traffic along with cruise vessels calling at Goa. The port manages cargo from local industries and hinterland states while working on traffic diversification away from highly polluting commodities, introducing environmental safeguards, and improving berth infrastructure. Cruise calls supporting Goa’s tourism sector and coastal shipping initiatives are increasingly important activities.

major_business.S: Export and import of minerals and coal, general cargo, liquid bulk, coastal cargo movement and cruise tourism, serving both Goan industries and wider regional trade along the Konkan belt.

L.S: Multi-purpose berths for bulk and general cargo
Mechanised handling systems for select bulk commodities
Rail connectivity to the Konkan and national rail network
Cruise terminal facilities for passenger vessels
Storage yards and cargo handling equipment on the waterfront

description.S: New Mangalore Port, located at Panambur near Mangaluru in Karnataka, is the only major port of the state and serves as the maritime gateway for a wide hinterland that includes Karnataka, parts of Kerala and the interior regions of South US. Commissioned in the 1970s, it was developed to handle crude oil, petroleum products, fertilizers and various bulk commodities supporting refineries, petrochemical complexes and agricultural trade in the region. Over time the port has diversified into container traffic, LPG imports, coal for power plants, and project cargo for industrial and infrastructure projects. The port’s location along the west coast, relatively uncongested approaches and improving connectivity to national highways and railway lines make it an attractive hub for both EXIM and coastal trade.

current_activities.S: Handling of crude oil and POL products, LPG, fertilizers, coal, containers and general cargo. The port facilitates coastal shipping of petroleum products and bulk cargo, supports nearby refineries and fertilizer plants, and caters to agricultural exports like coffee and cashew. Efforts are ongoing to attract more container services, upgrade cargo-handling infrastructure, and improve hinterland connectivity to industrial and logistics hubs in Karnataka.

major_business.S: Crude oil and petroleum products for nearby refineries, LPG imports, fertilizers, coal for power and industry, containerised cargo on regional services, general and project cargo supporting industrial and infrastructure development in Karnataka and surrounding regions.

L.S: Oil jetties and liquid cargo handling systems
Dedicated berths for fertilizers, coal and general cargo
Container handling facilities and yard space
Storage tanks, warehouses and open stacking areas

description.S: Cochin Port is located on Willingdon Island in Kochi, Kerala, facing the Arabian Sea and serving as a key maritime hub for south-west US. Developed during the early 20th century and formally commissioned in the 1930s, it has historically been a gateway for spices, tea and other traditional exports from Kerala. Today the port handles containers, petroleum products, liquid chemicals, and dry bulk cargo while also being an important cruise destination. Its proximity to industrial areas of Kochi, refineries, special economic zones and the Cochin shipyard makes it strategically important. The adjacent Vallarpadam International Container Transshipment Terminal (ICTT) aims to position the region as a transshipment and container hub in competition with overseas ports, supporting US’s coastal and international trade lanes.

current_activities.S: Container operations at the ICTT, handling of crude and petroleum products, fertilizers and chemicals, dry bulk like coal and food grains, and cruise ship calls bringing tourists to Kerala. The port is strengthening coastal shipping, integrating logistics with nearby industrial and logistics zones, and improving navigational channels and berthing facilities. Tourism-oriented development and integration with the city’s transport network are parallel focus areas.

major_business.S: Containers, crude and refined petroleum products, fertilizers and chemicals, coal, food grains, project cargo, and cruise tourism serving Kerala and southern USn hinterlands.

L.S: International container transshipment terminal at Vallarpadam
Oil jetties and liquid cargo terminals
Dry bulk berths and mechanised handling systems
Rail and road links to industrial zones and SEZs around Kochi

description.S: Kamarajar Port, commonly referred to as Ennore Port, lies north of Chennai along the eastern coast and is US’s first corporatised major port. Conceived to decongest Chennai Port and handle bulk and clean cargo away from the city, it is designed as a satellite deep-draft facility with modern infrastructure. The port initially focused on handling thermal coal for nearby power plants but has diversified into automobile exports, liquid cargo, LNG and containers in partnership with private operators. Its greenfield design, ample backup area and location outside the congested city core make it suitable for long-term expansion. Coordination with Chennai Port allows rational sharing of cargo categories and better traffic management in the region.

current_activities.S: Import of coal for power stations, handling of POL and liquid cargo, automobile exports via Ro-Ro, and increasing container and general cargo operations through PPP terminals. The port is also working on LNG handling, improving road and rail evacuation, and strengthening coastal shipping of bulk commodities. Environmental mitigation measures, dust control, and diversification towards cleaner cargo categories are key ongoing priorities.

major_business.S: Coal for power utilities, POL and liquid cargo, automobile exports, limited containerised cargo and project cargo for industrial and infrastructure projects in the Chennai and northern Tamil Nadu region.

L.S: Deep-draft berths for coal and liquid bulk
PPP terminals for containers and multi-purpose cargo
Extensive backup land for storage and future expansion
Rail and road connectivity to industrial corridors around Chennai

description.S: V.O. Chidambaranar Port, earlier known as Tuticorin Port, is situated in Thoothukudi on the south-eastern coast of Tamil Nadu. It functions as a prominent gateway port for southern Tamil Nadu and parts of Kerala, servicing a wide hinterland of industrial, agricultural and mining activity. The port has an artificial deep-water harbour with multiple berths and is known for its all-weather operations and minimal tidal variations. It handles containers, coal, fertilizers, salt, minerals and general cargo, serving both EXIM and coastal trade. With shorter sailing distances to ports in Sri Lanka and South-East Asia, the port is well positioned for regional services. Ongoing development of coal and container terminals, mechanisation and improved connectivity to industrial corridors are enhancing its competitiveness.

current_activities.S: Container handling, coal imports for power plants, fertilizer and raw material imports, export of salt, sugar, granite, and other commodities, along with coastal movement of cargo. The port focuses on mechanised handling systems, dredging to maintain deeper drafts, developing container terminals and improving rail and road links to hinterland clusters and industrial parks.

major_business.S: Containers, coal, fertilizers, industrial raw materials, export of salt, sugar, minerals and agro-products, and coastal trade serving southern Tamil Nadu and adjacent regions.

L.S: Container terminal with yard and rail connectivity
Coal and bulk cargo berths with mechanised handling
Berths for fertilizers, salt and general cargo
Road and rail links to industrial and mining areas around Thoothukudi

description.S: Visakhapatnam Port, located on the eastern coast of US along the Bay of Bengal, is one of the country’s largest and deepest ports. Serving as the maritime outlet for Andhra Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Odisha, Telangana and parts of central US, it has long been associated with handling iron ore and other bulk commodities. The port includes an inner and outer harbour with multiple terminals for iron ore, coal, crude oil, containers and general cargo. Over the years it has modernised with mechanised handling systems, PPP terminals and improved rail-road connectivity to mining belts and industrial clusters. Its strategic location near major shipping routes and natural depth allows it to cater to large bulk carriers and container vessels, making it an important gateway for both raw materials and finished goods.

current_activities.S: Handling of iron ore, coal, crude oil and POL products, containers, fertilizers and general cargo. The port is engaged in expanding mechanised bulk handling, developing container capacity, supporting coastal shipping and integrating with industrial corridors such as the Vizag–Chennai Industrial Corridor. Environmental management, dredging, and berth upgrades are ongoing to sustain deeper drafts and high traffic volumes.

major_business.S: Iron ore, coal and other bulk cargo for steel and power sectors, crude oil and POL, fertilizers, containerised exports and imports, and coastal trade connecting east coast ports and inland industrial regions.

L.S: Inner and outer harbours with mechanised bulk handling systems
Oil jetties for crude and POL
Specialised berths for iron ore and coal
Extensive rail sidings and road links to the mineral and industrial hinterland

description.S: Paradip Port, situated on the eastern coast of US at the confluence of the Mahanadi River and the Bay of Bengal, is a deep-draft, all-weather port that serves as the maritime gateway for Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Jharkhand and parts of central US. Commissioned in 1966, it has evolved into one of the largest bulk-handling ports in the country, particularly known for coal, iron ore, crude oil and POL products. Its strategic location close to mineral-rich belts, expanding industrial corridors and steel and power plants makes it a crucial node in US’s raw material and energy supply chains. The port features mechanised berths, rail connectivity to major mining belts, and comprehensive facilities for handling hazardous, dry bulk and liquid cargo. Ongoing expansion includes deepening of channels, development of multi-cargo berths, and capacity enhancement under PPP mode.

current_activities.S: Mechanised handling of coal, iron ore and pellets, crude oil and POL operations, coastal movement of dry bulk, container traffic in limited volumes, and support for steel, mining and power sectors in the hinterland. The port is also working on dredging for deeper drafts, commissioning auxiliary berths, improving mechanised systems and scaling operations to handle cape-size vessels more efficiently.

major_business.S: Coal imports and exports, iron ore, pellets, crude oil, petroleum products, fertilizers, limestone, gypsum, and coastal shipping serving power plants, steel industries and fertilizer units.

L.S: Mechanised coal and iron ore berths
Oil jetty for crude and POL
Rail connectivity to major mining zones
Covered storage sheds and open yards

description.S: Syama Prasad Mookerjee Port (formerly Kolkata Port) is US’s oldest operating port with origins dating back to the 19th century. Located 200 km inland on the Hooghly River, it is the only riverine major port in the country. The port operates through two dock systems—Kolkata Dock System (KDS) and Haldia Dock Complex (HDC). KDS handles break-bulk, container and general cargo, while HDC caters to bulk cargo, POL, LPG and container vessels. Due to its geographical position, the port serves the entire eastern and northeastern region, including bordering countries like Nepal and Bhutan. It also provides strategic access to Bangladesh and is a gateway for trade with Southeast Asia. Continuous dredging, river navigation, and modernization make it a complex yet vital part of US’s maritime footprint.

current_activities.S: Handling of containers, break-bulk cargo, liquid bulk, LPG, fertilizers, coal, fly ash exports, and bagged cargo. The port supports inland waterway operations, coastal shipping, and maintains regular services to Bangladesh and ASEAN routes. Heavy emphasis is on maintaining navigational channels, upgrading equipment, and developing logistics parks in West Bengal.

major_business.S: Containers, break-bulk cargo, POL and LPG, fly ash, coal, fertilizers, project cargo, and cross-border trade with Bangladesh, Nepal, Bhutan and northeastern US.

L.S: Kolkata Dock System for container and break-bulk
Haldia Dock Complex for bulk and liquid cargo
Rail and road connectivity to eastern and northeastern US
Riverine jetties and inland water transport services

description.S: Mundra Port, developed by Adani Ports & SEZ Ltd., is US’s largest privately operated commercial port located on the Gulf of Kutch in Gujarat. Established in 1998, it has grown into a global-scale gateway port with ultra-modern infrastructure, deep-water berths, large container terminals, liquid tank farms, Ro-Ro terminals, coal import terminals, and specialized cargo handling zones. It serves the industrial corridors of Gujarat, Rajasthan, Haryana and northern US. With world-class automation and multi-modal connectivity through road, rail and pipelines, Mundra has become a critical trade node with exports and imports exceeding those of many major ports combined. It is also part of a vast SEZ and logistics ecosystem.

current_activities.S: Handling large-scale containers, automotive shipments via Ro-Ro, bulk cargo like coal and iron ore, liquid cargo including petroleum and chemicals, and project/general cargo. The port runs US's largest private rail line, operates advanced automated container terminals, and manages huge coal-handling capacities for power and industrial clients.

major_business.S: Containers, automobiles, coal, petroleum, LNG, fertilizers, agri-products, project cargo, and EXIM trade supporting industrial clusters in northern and western US.

L.S: Liquid storage terminals and tank farms
Automated coal and bulk handling systems

description.S: Hazira Port, located near Surat on the Gulf of Khambhat, is a deep-water, all-weather private port operated by Adani Hazira Port Pvt. Ltd. It serves the industrial belts of South Gujarat including Surat, Bharuch, Ankleshwar and Vapi. The port handles containers, bulk, break-bulk and liquid cargo and is strategically positioned for industries ranging from petrochemicals to textiles. With its deep draft and modern infrastructure, Hazira is an important alternate gateway to the busy ports of Gujarat.

current_activities.S: Handling containers, general cargo, bulk commodities, LNG imports, and coastal shipping. The port supports nearby industries including refineries, chemical plants and textile units.

major_business.S: Containers, LNG, petrochemical products, steel, cement, fertilizers, general cargo and project cargo.

description.S: Dahej Port, located in Bharuch district of Gujarat, is a strategically positioned industrial port serving petrochemical complexes, fertilizer plants, power projects and chemical industries in the Dahej Special Economic Zone (SEZ) and Petroleum, Chemicals and Petrochemicals Investment Region (PCPIR). The port handles a wide variety of dry bulk, liquid chemicals, LNG and project cargo. It is a major import gateway for raw materials used in chemical and energy industries across western US.

current_activities.S: Handling liquid chemicals, dry bulk, LNG, project cargo and raw materials for chemical industries. It supports coastal movement and has strong ties with nearby industrial clusters.

major_business.S: LNG, chemicals, fertilizers, coal, limestone, and heavy project cargo supporting petrochemical and industrial hubs.

L.S: Road and rail connectivity to industrial SEZ zones

description.S: Pipavav Port, operated by APM Terminals, is one of US’s first private-sector ports located in the Amreli district of Gujarat. Operational since 2001, the port is recognised for its efficient container handling, automobile exports, bulk operations and excellent hinterland connectivity through rail and road. It serves Gujarat, Rajasthan, Delhi NCR and parts of Madhya Pradesh, offering an efficient alternative to ports in the Gulf of Kutch.

current_activities.S: Container operations, automobile exports, fertilizer and agri-bulk handling, liquid cargo management and coastal shipping services.

major_business.S: Containers, automobiles, fertilizers, agri-products, break-bulk, project cargo and EXIM trade for northern and western US.

description.S: Dighi Port, located in Raigad district of Maharashtra, is a privately operated deep-water port on the eastern coast of the Arabian Sea. Positioned strategically close to the Mumbai–Pune industrial corridor, the port caters to bulk cargo, break-bulk, project cargo and liquid chemicals. It is undergoing expansion under new ownership with plans to build container terminals and integrate with logistics and industrial zones.

current_activities.S: Bulk cargo handling, liquid chemical operations, coastal shipping and project cargo movements supporting industries in Raigad, Pune and Nashik.

major_business.S: Chemicals, fertilizers, break-bulk, steel, heavy machinery and raw materials for Maharashtra’s industrial belts.

L.S: Excellent road connectivity to industrial zones

description.S: Jaigarh Port, located in the Ratnagiri district of Maharashtra, is a strategic deep-water private port operated by JSW Infrastructure. Positioned along the Konkan coastline, the port handles bulk, liquid and break-bulk cargo, supporting JSW's steel and power plants and other industries. It serves as an emerging logistics gateway for Maharashtra’s industrial zones and offers deep drafts suitable for large bulk carriers.

current_activities.S: Handling coal, limestone, iron ore, liquid cargo and break-bulk for industries in Maharashtra. The port also supports project cargo and coastal shipping.

major_business.S: Coal, limestone, steel raw materials, liquid cargo, break-bulk, project cargo and coastal shipments.

L.S: Dedicated connectivity to JSW industrial units

description.S: Dharamtar Port, located on the Amba River near Pen and Alibaug, serves as an industrial port for the Mumbai–Pune region. Operated by JSW Infrastructure, it is primarily a bulk and break-bulk handling port supporting steel, cement, construction, and energy industries, with barge-based movement from larger ports and coastal terminals.

current_activities.S: Bulk cargo handling, movement of steel coils, cement, break-bulk commodities, barges, and raw materials for industrial clusters in Pune and Raigad.

major_business.S: Steel products, cement, fly ash, gypsum, construction materials and break-bulk.

L.S: Road connectivity to Mumbai–Pune industrial zones

description.S: Rewas Port, located south of Mumbai at the mouth of the Patalganga River, is a deep-water port project aimed at serving the Mumbai–Pune industrial corridor. Designed to accommodate large-capacity vessels, the port is intended to handle bulk, liquid and container cargo. While still under phased development, Rewas is planned as a major logistics hub for Maharashtra with connectivity to national highways and freight corridors.

current_activities.S: Limited commercial operations; planned activities include container handling, bulk handling, liquid cargo and automotive logistics.

major_business.S: Planned: containers, bulk cargo, liquid cargo, and logistics services for industries in the Mumbai–Pune region.

description.S: Porbandar Port is a prominent minor port located on the Arabian Sea coast of Gujarat. Historically known for its maritime trade links and fishing industry, the port has evolved into an important hub for general cargo, coastal shipping and fishing activities. The port’s natural harbour, close proximity to Saurashtra’s industrial and agricultural belts, and sheltered anchorage make it suitable for various cargo movements. While it does not handle very large vessels due to draft limitations, Porbandar plays a significant role in coastal trade, cement exports, salt shipment, fishing harbour support, and movement of construction materials. The port continues to undergo improvements in handling systems, breakwaters, warehouses and connectivity to support regional industrial demand.

current_activities.S: Handling of cement, clinker, salt, food grains, fertilizer, coastal cargo movements, fishing vessels and general merchandise. The port also facilitates lighterage operations for ships anchored offshore and supports the local fishing economy with dedicated jetties and auction yards.

major_business.S: Salt exports, cement and clinker exports, food grains, coastal movement of bulk cargo, fishing activities and lighterage-based cargo movement.

L.S: Road connectivity to Saurashtra industrial zones

description.S: Okha Port lies on the western tip of the Saurashtra peninsula, close to the entrance of the Gulf of Kutch. Historically recognized as a harbour for fishing and lighterage operations, Okha has gradually developed into a multipurpose minor port handling raw materials, break-bulk, petroleum products and ferry services. The port’s location near Dwarka also makes it a regional maritime node for passenger movement and coastal connectivity. Although draft limitations restrict very large vessels, Okha is strategically used for offshore supply, bunkering support, coastal trade and passenger ferry services to islands such as Bet Dwarka. Ongoing development programs include strengthening berths, expanding ferry terminals and improving cargo handling infrastructure.

current_activities.S: Handling break-bulk and general cargo, offshore supply operations, petroleum product movement, ferry services to Bet Dwarka, coastal shipping, and support for fishing-related activity in the region.

major_business.S: General cargo, petroleum products, offshore supply, coastal cargo, ferry services and fishing-related logistics.

description.S: Veraval Port is one of US’s most important fishing ports, located along the southern coast of Gujarat in the Gir-Somnath district. Known for its massive fishing fleet, cold storage units and seafood processing industries, Veraval facilitates large-scale fish landing and export operations. Historically used as a landing point for coastal craft and general cargo, the port is now predominantly oriented toward fishing and associated marine trade. Its significance has grown due to the booming seafood export market and the presence of several fish meal and processing plants in the region. Development initiatives include modernization of fish landing centres, cold chain expansion, and support facilities for fishermen and cargo operators.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, seafood exports, ice and cold storage operations, coastal transport of perishable goods, minor general cargo operations and marine workshop services.

major_business.S: Fish and marine products, frozen seafood exports, fish meal, coastal perishable cargo, boat repair and fishing equipment supplies.

L.S: Auction platforms and fishing harbour infrastructure

description.S: Jakhau Port is situated near the western border of US in the Kutch region of Gujarat. It is primarily known as a major fishing harbour and serves as a safe anchorage for fishing vessels operating in the Arabian Sea. The port’s naturally sheltered location and proximity to marine-rich waters make it a critical hub for fisheries and seafood-related trade. Although it does not handle large commercial cargo, it plays a vital socioeconomic role by supporting thousands of fishermen, fish processing units and related maritime services. Recent developments include modernization of the fishing harbour, upgrading jetties, cold storage facilities and strengthening coastal infrastructure.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, fish landing, seafood logistics, boat maintenance and related marine services. The port also handles limited coastal cargo movement when required.

major_business.S: Fish and seafood products, fishing equipment supply, cold chain logistics, coastal fish trade.

L.S: Fuel supply and water supply facilities
Sheltered anchorage for large fishing fleets

description.S: Bhavnagar Port, located in the Gulf of Khambhat, is one of the oldest minor ports in Gujarat. Historically serving princely states and coastal traders, it is known for its break-bulk, general cargo and salt exports. Due to the region’s strong ship-breaking and industrial clusters, the port supports steel scrap handling, salt movement and coastal logistics. Despite tidal variations that limit larger vessels, Bhavnagar remains a regionally important maritime outlet with development plans focusing on modernization of berths, improved navigational channels and better connectivity to industrial zones surrounding the city.

current_activities.S: Handling salt, steel plates, scrap, fertilizers, building materials, coastal cargo and lighterage operations. The port also supports traffic from the nearby Alang ship-breaking yard.

major_business.S: Salt exports, steel scrap, break-bulk cargo, fertilizer import, general cargo movement and coastal trade.

description.S: Magdalla Port, located along the Tapi River estuary near Surat, serves the industrial and textile-rich region of South Gujarat. It historically handled cement, fertilizer and break-bulk cargo, and continues to support small-scale general cargo, petroleum products, chemicals and coastal trade. Its strategic position close to Surat makes it an important logistics link for local industries. Although capacity constraints limit very large operations, modernization and expansion efforts focus on improving cargo handling and warehousing capabilities.

current_activities.S: Handling petroleum products, cement, fertilizers, break-bulk cargo, small-scale liquid cargo and coastal movements for industries around Surat.

major_business.S: Petroleum, cement, fertilizers, general cargo, textile-related materials and chemical trade.

L.S: Road connectivity to Surat industrial zones

description.S: Navlakhi Port is located on the Gulf of Kutch near Morbi district in Gujarat. It is known for handling coal, salt and lignite cargo serving the ceramic and industrial clusters of Morbi. The port has a long history of maritime trade and functions mainly as an anchorage port where vessels discharge cargo at the outer anchorage and barges ferry materials to the shore. Its strategic proximity to industries in Morbi and Kutch makes it vital for raw material supply, especially for tiles, ceramics and associated industries.

current_activities.S: Handling coal, lignite, salt and break-bulk cargo through lighterage operations and supporting industrial freight movement for Morbi-based manufacturing clusters.

major_business.S: Coal, lignite, salt, industrial raw materials, break-bulk materials and coastal cargo movement.

L.S: Open storage yards for salt and coal
Road connectivity to Morbi industrial zone
Basic port services and support buildings

description.S: Mandvi Port is a historical maritime trading centre located in the Kutch district of Gujarat. Known for its dhow-building heritage, Mandvi has played an important role in US's coastal and international trade with the Gulf countries. While its commercial cargo operations are limited today, the port remains active in coastal trade, fishing, and light cargo movement. Its rich maritime history, along with cultural and tourism significance, also makes Mandvi a unique port town along the Gujarat coastline.

current_activities.S: Coastal cargo movement, fishing operations, small-scale general cargo transport and tourism-related marine activities.

major_business.S: Coastal goods, fishing products, wooden dhow-related trade, minor general cargo and tourism.

description.S: Betul Port is a small coastal port in South Goa, primarily used for fishing, coastal transport and minor cargo movements. Situated at the mouth of the Sal River, the port serves as a traditional fishing harbour and supports local tourism through river cruises, boats and small passenger craft. While not a major commercial cargo port, Betul plays an important role in local fisheries, cultural tourism and coastal connectivity. Development projects have focused on improving fishing landing facilities, safe navigation and infrastructure to support tourism.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, minor cargo handling, passenger boat services and tourism-based marine activities such as river cruises and dolphin-watching boats.

major_business.S: Fish and seafood, local tourism services, passenger boat operations, coastal goods transport.

description.S: Karwar Port, located along the Karnataka coastline near the Kali River estuary, is a sheltered natural harbour surrounded by low-lying islands that protect the port from strong monsoon winds. Historically known for maritime trade, fishing and naval support, Karwar has grown steadily as a coastal and minor cargo port. The region’s strategic importance has led to major defence establishments, and the port has increasingly been used for project cargo, break-bulk, construction materials and coastal trade. Due to ongoing infrastructure development including berth extension, dredging and improved road connectivity to Hubballi and northern Karnataka, Karwar is positioned to handle higher traffic in coming years.

current_activities.S: Handling of coal, limestone, break-bulk cargo, food grains, construction materials and coastal shipments. Karwar also supports fishing operations, passenger ferries and project cargo for defence and infrastructure projects.

major_business.S: Coal, limestone, break-bulk cargo, project cargo, food grains, coastal shipping and regional fishing industry support.

L.S: Connectivity to NH-66 and Karnataka interiors

description.S: Malpe Port, located near Udupi on the Karnataka coast, is one of US's largest fishing harbours and an important maritime centre for coastal trade. The port hosts an extensive fishing fleet, seafood industries, cold storage and auction centres, and is a major base for deep-sea fishing. The presence of multiple fish-processing plants and export units highlights its importance in the aquaculture supply chain. Malpe also supports light cargo, passenger boats, tourism boats and marine-related services, making it a diversified minor port with both commercial and community significance.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, seafood exports, cold storage operations, coastal shipping, small cargo movement, tourism boats and passenger services to nearby islands.

major_business.S: Fish, seafood, ice and cold storage supply, coastal goods, passenger boat tourism and fishing equipment logistics.

L.S: Large fishing harbour and landing quay
Warehousing and open yards for fish trade

description.S: Honnavar Port is positioned on the Karnataka coast at the Sharavati River estuary. Historically a coastal trading point, the port now focuses on fishing, small cargo shipping and regional maritime logistics. Its sheltered river mouth area facilitates lighter vessels and fishing operations. The port’s growth is tied to the local economy, supporting the movement of agricultural goods, construction materials and regional coastal cargo. Development efforts include modernization of berths, mechanized equipment, fishermen support systems and improved access roads for trade expansion.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, small-scale coastal cargo movement, general merchandise handling, barge loading and unloading, and local trade support.

major_business.S: Fish, agricultural products, construction goods, coastal break-bulk cargo and local transport supplies.

description.S: Beypore Port is one of Kerala’s oldest ports located near Kozhikode. It has a long maritime heritage linked to dhow building (Uru ships) and Arabian trade routes. Today, it functions as a fishing and coastal cargo port with significant passenger ferry services to Lakshadweep islands. The port also handles break-bulk goods, timber logs, and small-scale cargo shipments. Because of its historical ship-building culture, Beypore continues to draw craftsmanship and tourism interest while maintaining its operational maritime activities.

current_activities.S: Passenger ferry operations to Lakshadweep, fishing, break-bulk cargo handling, timber trade, coastal shipping and ship-building (Uru construction).

major_business.S: Timber, break-bulk cargo, passenger services, seafood, dhow-building and coastal trade.

description.S: Neendakara Port is a major fisheries port on the Kerala coast known for housing one of the largest fishing fleets in the state. Located near Kollam, the port plays a vital role in Kerala’s seafood export chain with extensive fish landing centers, ice plants, cold storage facilities and seafood processing industries. While it handles limited coastal cargo, the port’s economic significance comes from the marine and fishing sectors. Its large fisherman community and extensive support infrastructure make it one of the most active fishing hubs in US.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, seafood exports, boat maintenance, ice and cold storage activities, coastal shipping of perishable goods and fisheries administration.

major_business.S: Seafood exports, fish meal, cold chain transport, fishing equipment trade and coastal perishable cargo.

L.S: Large fishing harbour with boat berths
Cold storage and seafood processing units

description.S: Vizhinjam Port, located near Thiruvananthapuram, is US’s first deep-water international container transshipment port developed under a PPP model. With natural depths of over 20 meters and proximity to major east-west shipping lanes, Vizhinjam is intended to compete with global transshipment hubs like Colombo and Singapore. While large-scale commercial operations are being commissioned, the port currently functions as a fishing and coastal operations hub. Once fully operational, it is expected to drastically reduce US's dependency on foreign transshipment ports.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, coastal vessel support, preparatory logistics for container transshipment operations and limited port services during phased rollout.

major_business.S: Future: Container transshipment, feeder operations, maritime logistics hub. Current: Fishing and small-scale coastal activity.

L.S: Connectivity to NH-66 and inland transport networks

description.S: Ponnani Port is a riverine port located at the mouth of the Bharathapuzha river in Kerala. Historically significant for maritime trade with Arab nations, it has evolved into a coastal cargo and fishing port. The port is well-positioned to serve Malappuram, Palakkad and nearby hinterlands. Development plans include multimodal logistics parks and expansion of coastal cargo operations. Dredging and modernization efforts are ongoing to improve its cargo-handling capabilities while maintaining its strong fishing sector.

current_activities.S: Fishing, coastal cargo movement, handling of cement, salt and break-bulk cargo, and passenger boat services.

major_business.S: Cement, salt, break-bulk, seafood, coastal goods transport and small passenger movement.

description.S: Kollam Port is Kerala’s second-largest port with a long maritime legacy dating back to ancient trade with the Romans, Chinese and Arabs. Located in southern Kerala, the port handles cashew imports, seafood, break-bulk cargo and coastal trade. Its location near Kollam’s industrial and cashew-processing hubs makes it a key port for raw cashew imports and associated trade. The port is being modernized with improved berths, mechanized handling and enhanced coastal shipping capabilities to support Kerala’s industrial growth.

current_activities.S: Import of raw cashew nuts, seafood trade, coastal cargo movement, break-bulk handling, passenger ferry services and fishing activities.

major_business.S: Cashew, seafood, timber, fertilizers, break-bulk, coastal cargo and local passenger movement.

description.S: This minor anchorage port cluster around Thoothukudi supports smaller vessels, fishing boats, mechanised craft and coastal shipping operating outside the main V.O. Chidambaranar Port. Historically, these jetties and anchorages handled salt, small-scale exports and inter-coastal trade. The region continues to serve as a supplementary harbour for fishing fleets, salt movement, boat repair and small cargo handling that cannot be routed through the mechanised VOC Port. Infrastructure improvements focus on fishing welfare, safe navigation and supporting local industries.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, salt exports, small break-bulk cargo, coastal movement, boat maintenance and community marine services.

major_business.S: Salt, fish, small cargo, coastal materials, traditional maritime trade and related services.

description.S: Krishnapatnam Port, located in Nellore district of Andhra Pradesh, is one of US’s fastest-growing deep-water ports developed under a PPP model. Although a major commercial port, it was historically classified under state control as a minor port. With deep draft, mechanised terminals and world-class infrastructure, it handles coal, iron ore, containers, edible oil, agri-bulk, project cargo and more. Its strategic location near the Chennai–Bengaluru Industrial Corridor and NH-16 corridor makes it a critical logistics hub connecting southern and central US.

current_activities.S: Handling coal, iron ore, fertilizers, containers, edible oil, agri-bulk, steel and project cargo as well as coastal cargo movement. The port continues to expand its berths, mechanised handling, and LNG and container capacities.

major_business.S: Coal, iron ore, fertilizers, containers, edible oil, grains, construction materials and large industrial cargo for Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Karnataka.

L.S: Excellent road/rail integration to industrial corridors

description.S: Kakinada Port, located along the east coast of Andhra Pradesh, is one of US’s most active minor ports supporting significant agricultural and industrial trade. The port serves a fertile hinterland rich in rice, seafood, petroleum products and fertilizers. It comprises the Kakinada Anchorage Port and the Deep Water Port. With large quantities of rice, maize, seafood, fertilizers and chemicals moving through the port, Kakinada has become a major export hub for food grains and aqua products. The port is strategically connected to NH-216, industrial belts of East Godavari, and the Kakinada SEZ, making it a vital node for coastal shipping and international logistics.

current_activities.S: Export of rice and agri-products, import of fertilizers and petrochemicals, coastal cargo movement, seafood logistics, container feeders, and barge-based lighterage operations.

major_business.S: Rice, maize, seafood, fertilizers, chemicals, edible oil, coal, petroleum products and coastal cargo.

description.S: Gangavaram Port, located south of Visakhapatnam, is one of US’s deepest all-weather ports, developed as a private-sector gateway port to support large bulk volumes. Known for its 21+ meter natural depth, it handles cape-size vessels and has become the preferred port for industries in Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and central US. With advanced mechanization and vast storage yards, Gangavaram specializes in coal, iron ore, limestone, fertilizers, steel products and industrial cargo. Its seamless link with major steel plants and industrial clusters makes it a high-productivity port with rapid vessel turnaround times.

current_activities.S: Bulk cargo handling (coal, iron ore, limestone), steel products, fertilizers, petcoke, gypsum, project cargo and coastal bulk movements. Expansion includes container and liquid cargo capabilities.

major_business.S: Coal, iron ore, steel, limestone, fertilizers, petcoke, gypsum, alumina and heavy industrial cargo.

description.S: Machilipatnam Port is a historic trading port located in Krishna district of Andhra Pradesh. Known for its centuries-old maritime routes connecting Southeast Asia and Europe, the modern port supports coastal cargo movement, fishing and regional trade. Although large-scale commercial port development is ongoing, Machilipatnam still serves as a vital node for maritime heritage, fishing communities and coastal industries. The port area is being modernized with plans for deep-water berths, industrial parks and logistics zones.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, coastal shipping, small-scale cargo handling, local boat services and development activities for new port expansion.

major_business.S: Fish, textiles, agri-products, salt, small cargo and coastal materials.

description.S: Nagapattinam Port, located on the southeastern coast of Tamil Nadu, has a long maritime history dating back to Chola-era trade with Southeast Asia. In modern times, it functions as a fishing and coastal port handling small cargo, petroleum products, construction materials and marine logistics. The port is also a key hub for Sri Lankan ferry routes and passenger services during special operations. Nagapattinam is undergoing redevelopment to support larger industrial and logistics activities in the delta region.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, handling petroleum products, coastal cargo movement, inter-island passenger services and support for local industries.

major_business.S: Fish, fuel, construction materials, fertilizers, small break-bulk cargo and coastal shipping.

description.S: Cuddalore Port, located along the Coromandel Coast, has historically served agricultural and industrial regions of Tamil Nadu. While the port’s scale remains modest, it handles coastal cargo, fertilizers, sugar, timber and petroleum products for nearby industries. Cuddalore's geography supports barge operations and coastal movement. Current development aims to modernize berths, improve fishing harbour facilities and establish new terminals under public-private partnerships.

current_activities.S: Handling fertilizers, sugar, timber, break-bulk cargo, coastal shipments and fishing operations.

major_business.S: Fertilizers, sugar, timber, petroleum products, rice and general cargo.

description.S: Colachel Port is located in the Kanyakumari district of Tamil Nadu and is strategically positioned near the international east-west shipping route in the USn Ocean. Although currently a minor port, it is slated for major expansion under the proposed Colachel International Transshipment Port project. The port already supports fishing and small cargo operations while acting as a landing center for marine products. Its future development aims to create a deep-draft container transshipment hub that could serve as an USn alternative to Colombo or Singapore.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, minor cargo handling, small passenger vessels and preparatory development activities for future mega-port construction.

major_business.S: Fish, coastal cargo, construction materials and future container transshipment.

description.S: Tharangambadi, formerly known as Tranquebar, is a historically significant minor port on the Tamil Nadu coast. Once a Danish colony and trading port, it now serves fishing communities and small coastal vessels. The port retains cultural and historical importance, with ancient fortifications overlooking the coastline. Today, it handles small quantities of general cargo and fishing activities while supporting heritage tourism. Its calm coastal environment makes it suitable for minor maritime operations.

current_activities.S: Fishing, small-scale general cargo, coastal movement, tourism-related boat activities and local community services.

major_business.S: Fish, general cargo, coastal goods and tourism-linked marine services.

description.S: Pamban Port, situated near Rameswaram Island, is a historically important maritime centre supporting fishing, ferry operations and small cargo movement. The port lies close to the Palk Strait shipping channel, which once connected US and Sri Lanka through active ferry services. While ferry services ceased in the 1980s, the port remains essential for fishing communities, boat maintenance, and coastal passenger movement. Expansion plans include re-establishing international passenger links and strengthening fishing facilities.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, passenger boat services, coastal cargo, marine repair work and ferry-related infrastructure maintenance.

major_business.S: Fish, tourism, coastal cargo and potential international ferry services.

description.S: Kozhikode Port, historically known as Calicut Port, is an ancient maritime trading point famously connected to Arab, Chinese and European trade for centuries. While it no longer handles large commercial ships, it remains a culturally significant port supporting fishing, coastal craft, and tourism. The port’s legacy is tied to spice trade routes and centuries-old maritime history. Today the port area houses fishing communities, passenger boats and maritime heritage structures.

current_activities.S: Fishing, small passenger boats, coastal operations, tourism boats and community maritime activities.

major_business.S: Fish, local passenger services, coastal goods and tourism-based marine activities.

description.S: The Margoa inland-port region refers to the coastal jetties and maritime facilities along the Sal River in South Goa that support fishing, minor coastal movement, and tourism-related activities. While not a deep-sea cargo port, it serves as a logistical and passenger point for river transport, fishing vessels and water-based tourism. The region benefits from Goa's strong tourism sector and supports ferry transport, fishing landings and recreational boating.

current_activities.S: Fishing, river transport, tourism cruises, coastal passenger services, and small-scale general cargo movement.

major_business.S: Fish, small passenger services, tourism boats, local coastal trade and riverine transport.

description.S: Chennai Fishing Harbour is located adjacent to Chennai Port and is one of the busiest artisanal and mechanized fishing harbours on the eastern coast of US. Established to support the large fishing community of Chennai, the harbour accommodates hundreds of mechanized boats, trawlers, and fish-landing vessels. It is a key center for seafood supply feeding Chennai's wholesale markets and processing units. The harbour includes auction halls, cold chain facilities, ice plants, net mending yards and retail fish stalls. Despite congestion and limited berthing space, it plays a vital role in the coastal economy and supports thousands of fishermen and seafood workers daily.

current_activities.S: Fish landing operations, seafood auctioning, ice and cold storage management, boat repair, mechanized trawler operations, and supply chain logistics for wholesale fish markets across Chennai.

major_business.S: Fresh fish, seafood, ice supply, fishing equipment, coastal fish trade and cold chain distribution.

description.S: Cuddalore Fishing Harbour is a key marine center for the coastal districts of Tamil Nadu, providing berthing, fish landing, and auction platforms for a large fishing fleet. Located near the estuary of the Gadilam River, the harbour supports both mechanized trawlers and traditional craft. It has become vital for seafood collection, retail distribution, export of dried fish, and processing activities. With continuous support from fisheries departments, the harbour is undergoing modern upgrades to improve sanitation, cold chain efficiency, and facilities for the fishermen community.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, auctioning, drying of fish, supply of ice and fuel, repair of fishing vessels, and coastal distribution of seafood to major Tamil Nadu markets.

major_business.S: Fresh and dried fish, marine by-products, fishing equipment, ice distribution and coastal seafood logistics.

description.S: Pondicherry Port is a riverine and coastal port located in the Union Territory of Puducherry. Historically a French trading point, the port was once a hub for maritime exports of agricultural and manufactured goods. Although large-scale commercial cargo has declined, the port has been undergoing revival efforts aimed at reintroducing coastal movement of cargo, ferry services, and tourism activities. Its strategic location between Chennai and Cuddalore makes it well-positioned for regional maritime connectivity. Current development includes strengthening of breakwaters, dredging of the channel, and creation of passenger terminals.

current_activities.S: Coastal cargo pilot operations, fishing activities, passenger ferry services, tourism cruises, and dredging works for port revival.

major_business.S: Construction materials, sand, coastal goods, marine tourism and fishing.

description.S: Yanam Port is situated along the Godavari River in the Yanam region of Puducherry. It functions primarily as an inland and riverine port with potential for coastal cargo through the Kakinada–Yanam channel. Historically influenced by French US’s trade activities, the port is being revived to support cargo barges, coastal movement and logistics for industrial clusters around Andhra Pradesh. Development projects include modern river jetties, barge terminals and dredging for deeper draft.

current_activities.S: Barge transport, riverine cargo movement, fishing, passenger boats and proposed integration with Kakinada Port for coastal trade.

major_business.S: Agri-products, chemicals, general cargo, river transport goods and coastal materials.

description.S: Kothi Port is an anchorage-based minor port located in the Amreli district of Gujarat. It primarily supports coastal shipping, salt movement, and general cargo operations. Known for its calm waters and sheltered position, the port plays a supporting role for agricultural and salt industries in the region. Although infrastructure is minimal, Kothi Port is important for regional logistics and traditional trade patterns along the Saurashtra coast.

current_activities.S: Salt transport, break-bulk cargo, coastal shipping, fishing craft operations and lighterage.

major_business.S: Salt, coastal break-bulk cargo, agri-products and small-scale trading goods.

description.S: Gopalpur Port is a deep-water all-weather port located in southern Odisha. Initially functioning as a small anchorage port, it has been redeveloped into a modern multipurpose port capable of handling large bulk cargo. Its location is strategically advantageous for mineral-rich districts of Odisha and northern Andhra Pradesh. The port handles coal, iron ore, limestone, fertilizers and industrial commodities. Expansion plans include container facilities, improved mechanization and deeper dredging.

current_activities.S: Handling of coal, iron ore, limestone, fertilizer raw materials, project cargo and coastal bulk commodities.

major_business.S: Coal, iron ore, limestone, dolomite, fertilizers, steel products and industrial raw materials.

description.S: Dhamra Port is an ultra-modern deep-water port located on the Odisha coast and operated by Adani Ports. Though categorized as a non-major port, its scale rivals major ports in US. With deep drafts, mechanised bulk handling, and large-capacity berths, Dhamra handles coal, iron ore, limestone, fertilizers, containers and general cargo. Its strategic location near mineral-rich Odisha, Jharkhand and West Bengal makes it a major maritime gateway for east US. It also houses one of US's largest LNG terminals.

current_activities.S: Handling coal, iron ore, limestone, fertilizers, edible oil, container services, LNG imports and coastal bulk cargo.

major_business.S: Coal, iron ore, LNG, limestone, fertilizers, edible oil, containers and industrial commodities.

description.S: Chandipur Port, located near Balasore in Odisha, is known for its unique receding sea phenomenon and its proximity to DRDO test facilities. As a minor port, its operations are limited but serve regional fishing, coastal vessels and small-scale cargo. It plays an important role in supporting fishing communities and limited commercial movement. Development is constrained due to environmental protection zones, but the port remains regionally relevant for local maritime activities.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, minor cargo movement, marine services and support activities for local communities.

major_business.S: Fish, marine products, coastal goods and local trade materials.

description.S: Bichitrapur Port is a small coastal port located near the Odisha–West Bengal border. It primarily supports fishing, limited coastal traffic, and lighterage operations. The region is known for its mangrove ecosystems and eco-tourism, which restricts large-scale industrial development. Despite its size, the port remains important to local fishermen and supports cross-coastal traffic for small boats.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, marine tourism, minor cargo handling, and local boat transport.

major_business.S: Fish, coastal commodities, tourism services and small-scale goods transport.

description.S: Digha Port lies near the coastal town of Digha on the West Bengal–Odisha border. Although still under development, it is envisioned as a fishing harbour and small coastal cargo port. Its location near busy tourist zones and fishing communities makes it ideal for marine tourism and fisheries trade. Long-term plans include constructing breakwaters, cargo jetties and passenger facilities. Currently, it supports artisanal fishing and small-scale marine activities.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, marine tourism, small-scale coastal cargo and support for local transport boats.

major_business.S: Fish, tourism vessels, coastal commodities and passenger boat logistics.

description.S: Shankarpur Port is a coastal fishing port located a few kilometers from Digha in West Bengal. It serves as a major landing center for deep-sea fishing vessels and trawlers operating in the northern Bay of Bengal. The port has grown into an important hub for the state’s seafood industry, featuring ice plants, processing units, cold storage and wholesale auction markets. In addition to fishing, Shankarpur handles small-scale coastal cargo and offers limited passenger boat services. Its proximity to Digha makes it integral to both fishing and tourism economies. Increasing demand for seafood exports has resulted in modernization efforts at the landing center and cold chain infrastructure.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, seafood auctioning, cold chain operations, ice supply, trawler servicing, local ferry service, and small coastal cargo handling.

major_business.S: Fish, marine products, ice supply, perishable coastal cargo and wholesale seafood distribution.

L.S: Open yards for drying and processing

description.S: Fraserganj is a coastal port and major fishing harbour located near Bakkhali in South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal. It accommodates numerous mechanized fishing vessels and provides key maritime infrastructure for the region’s marine economy. The port's strategic location supports fish landings from the Bay of Bengal and distribution to larger fish markets in Kolkata. The region is also known for wind energy installations and tourism, which adds economic diversification. Despite being a small harbour, Fraserganj plays a critical role in sustaining coastal livelihoods and fisheries export networks.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, seafood processing, cold storage logistics, small-scale cargo movement, and tourism-linked boating services.

major_business.S: Fish, seafood exports, ice production, fish meal processing and coastal logistics.

description.S: Haldia Anchorage is a lighterage-based minor port that functions as an auxiliary to the larger Haldia Dock System. It services large vessels unable to navigate the Hooghly River due to draft restrictions. Cargo is transferred from mother vessels to barges offshore and moved inland to Haldia and Kolkata. This anchorage is essential for handling coal, crude oil, fertilizers and bulk cargo destined for industries in eastern US. With high vessel traffic and strategic relevance, Haldia Anchorage plays a critical logistics role despite not being a mechanized port itself.

current_activities.S: Lighterage operations, bulk cargo transfer, barge loading, offshore anchorage support, and coastal movement of industrial raw materials.

major_business.S: Coal, crude oil, fertilizers, limestone, gypsum, iron ore and other dry bulk materials.

description.S: Gopalpur Fishing Harbour lies adjacent to the commercial Gopalpur Port and serves as a major landing center for marine fisheries in southern Odisha. Equipped with jetties, cold storage, ice plants, fish drying yards and processing units, the harbour supplies seafood to domestic and export markets. It plays a vital role in the livelihoods of fishing communities and supports logistics for the seafood value chain. While it does not handle cargo like its commercial counterpart, it is indispensable for the fisheries sector of Odisha.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, seafood sorting, ice production, cold chain logistics, fish drying, and supply distribution to regional markets.

major_business.S: Marine fish, shrimp, prawn, dried fish, fish meal and coastal perishable cargo.

description.S: Bheemunipatnam Port, located north of Visakhapatnam, is one of the oldest ports on the east coast of US. Once an active Dutch trading settlement, it played a major role in maritime trade during the colonial period. Today it operates primarily as a fishing and coastal port. With limited draft and infrastructure, it caters to fishing fleets, coastal cargo vessels and tourism boats. Its scenic location and historical remnants make it an emerging tourism spot while also serving the regional seafood industry.

current_activities.S: Fishing activities, small coastal cargo, passenger boating, seafood transport and tourism-related marine services.

major_business.S: Fish, dry fish, coastal goods, tourism services and small cargo.

description.S: Kalingapatnam Port is a historic coastal port in the Srikakulam district of Andhra Pradesh. Known for its ancient maritime heritage and trade links with Southeast Asia, it now serves fishing vessels, coastal cargo and local marine activities. The region is rich in agriculture, marine products and sand resources, giving the port relevance for localized logistics. Development efforts include improving fishing harbour facilities, dredging the channel and exploring coastal shipping revival.

current_activities.S: Fishing, small cargo movement, salt trade, coastal transport and tourism-based boating.

major_business.S: Fish, salt, agri-products, coastal materials and passenger boats.

description.S: Vadarevu Port, situated near Chirala in Andhra Pradesh, is known for its significant fishing activities and coastal trade potential. The port serves a large community of fisherfolk and supports the logistics of marine products, textiles, handloom goods and agri-products from the surrounding districts. Ongoing proposals aim to develop Vadarevu into a commercial cargo port under the state maritime board, enhancing its relevance for coastal shipping and regional economic activity.

current_activities.S: Fishing, coastal goods movement, textiles shipment, agri-products transportation and passenger boat services.

major_business.S: Seafood, dried fish, textiles, handloom products, agricultural produce and local coastal cargo.

description.S: Tupilipalem Port is a small coastal landing point located in the Nellore district of Andhra Pradesh. It mainly serves fishermen, local traders and coastal boat operators. The port area consists of sandy beaches used for landing craft and fishing vessels. Although limited in commercial cargo facilities, it is strategically important for coastal villages and supports the movement of fish, salt and agricultural produce. Development plans center on improving fishing facilities, boat jetties and navigational aids.

current_activities.S: Fishing, landing of boats, coastal trade of fish and salt, and local transport activities.

major_business.S: Fish, salt, agri-products and coastal small cargo.

description.S: Ramayapatnam Port is an under-development deep-water port project in the Prakasam district of Andhra Pradesh. Envisioned as a major maritime gateway for the state, it will support bulk cargo, industrial raw materials, containers and coastal shipping. Its strategic location near industrial corridors and national highways makes it a long-term logistics asset. Although still under construction, the project will drive industrial growth in central Andhra Pradesh, boosting exports and improving multimodal connectivity.

current_activities.S: Construction of breakwaters, dredging, land development, and early-stage logistics planning. Limited fishing activity continues in adjacent areas.

major_business.S: Future: Coal, iron ore, fertilizers, containers, agri-products and coastal cargo. Present: Fishing and minor coastal activities.

description.S: Manjeshwar Port is located near the Kerala–Karnataka border and serves as a small coastal port supporting fishing and limited marine cargo. The region is known for artisanal fishing communities and small marine craft operating along the Malabar Coast. Though not developed as a commercial cargo port, Manjeshwar remains important for coastal livelihoods, fish trade, and inter-village marine movement. Proposals have been made to develop better berthing facilities and fish landing infrastructure.

current_activities.S: Fishing, coastal boat landing, seafood distribution, small-scale cargo transport and marine community services.

major_business.S: Fish, dried seafood, local coastal cargo and fishing equipment trade.

description.S: Azhikkal Port is a minor seaport located near Kannur in northern Kerala, at the confluence of the Valapattanam River and the Arabian Sea. It serves as a coastal outlet for the Malabar region and has traditionally handled break-bulk, timber, construction materials and fertilizer cargo, alongside fishing activity. The port is strategically positioned close to industrial and agricultural belts of Kannur and Kasaragod districts, and has road and rail connectivity via Kannur city. Government plans have targeted Azhikkal for coastal shipping promotion and containerized cargo on a regional scale. Although the current draft limits very large vessels, the port’s sheltered estuarine setting and available waterfront make it suitable for gradual capacity augmentation and multimodal logistics in northern Kerala.

current_activities.S: Handling small coastal cargo such as construction materials, timber and fertilizers, supporting regional fishing fleets, and limited barge operations. Recent years have seen renewed interest in coastal shipping projects, cruise/tourist boat calls on a pilot basis, and infrastructure upgrades for safer navigation and cargo handling.

major_business.S: Construction materials, timber, fertilizers, small break-bulk cargo, regional agricultural commodities, and marine products from the Malabar coastal belt.

L.S: Basic transit sheds and open stacking yards
Road connectivity to Kannur town and NH-66
Navigational aids along the river channel

description.S: Munambam Port is situated at the northern extremity of Vypin Island near Kochi and is one of Kerala’s prominent fishing and coastal trade centres. It overlooks the Arabian Sea while being connected to the Periyar river system and backwaters, making it ideal for both marine and inland water operations. Munambam supports a substantial mechanised and traditional fishing fleet, and the adjoining fishing harbour and auction centres make it a major seafood landing point for Ernakulam district. In addition to fisheries, the port region handles limited coastal cargo, sand and building materials and supports passenger boat movement across backwater routes. Its integration with the Kochi urban cluster gives it strong market access and logistical relevance.

current_activities.S: Heavy fishing activity with daily fish landings, wholesale auction and distribution to Kochi markets, operation of ice plants and cold storage, coastal movement of sand and construction material, and passenger boat and small ferry services across nearby backwaters.

major_business.S: Fresh fish and seafood, dried fish, ice and cold chain services, coastal movement of building materials and local passenger and tourism-related boat operations.

L.S: Ice plants and cold storage units
Small cargo jetty for coastal materials
Passenger/ferry jetties to nearby backwater destinations

description.S: Kodungallur Port lies along the Periyar river mouth near the historically significant town of Kodungallur (ancient Muziris), which was once a thriving international trade centre linking the Malabar Coast with Roman, Arab and Chinese merchants. The modern minor port functions primarily as a riverine and coastal facility handling small barges and fishing craft. It serves local industries and agricultural hinterlands by enabling movement of sand, cement, fertilizers and general cargo in addition to acting as a fishing and inland water transport terminal. Though infrastructure is modest, Kodungallur’s heritage status and location near National Waterway corridors provide potential for tourism, cruise, and small container barge services in future.

current_activities.S: Coastal and riverine transport of sand and building materials, limited fertilizer and general cargo handling, fish landings for local markets, and use as a node for inland waterways and tourist boat operations connected to Muziris heritage projects.

major_business.S: Construction materials such as sand and cement, fertilizers, local agri-produce and fish, and heritage/tourism-linked water transport services.

L.S: Small cargo wharf on the riverfront
Boat jetties for inland and coastal craft
Storage yards for bulk construction materials
Tourist boat jetty connecting to Muziris heritage circuit

description.S: Ponnani Fishing Harbour forms the fisheries-focused part of the broader Ponnani port area situated at the mouth of the Bharathapuzha river on the Kerala coast. It is one of the important landing centres for marine fish on the central Kerala coastline, handling mechanised trawlers as well as traditional fishing craft. The harbour has auction platforms, cold storage, ice plants and basic processing sheds that support a busy trade in fresh fish distributed to Malappuram, Palakkad and neighbouring districts. Its riverine-cum-marine location offers shelter to boats and provides a natural base for year-round fishing operations with a large fisherfolk community dependent on these facilities.

current_activities.S: Daily fish landings from marine and estuarine fishing, wholesale auctions, icing and dispatch of fish by truck to inland markets, limited drying and processing, and repair and servicing of small fishing boats and gear.

major_business.S: Fresh fish, shrimp and other marine products, dried fish, ice supply, fishing gear services and ancillary marine logistics to support local fisheries.

L.S: Ice plants and small cold rooms
Market and loading area for truck dispatch

description.S: Muthalapozhi Port is a bar-mouth coastal facility in Thiruvananthapuram district of Kerala, developed primarily as a fishing harbour and safe haven for fishing vessels along the southern coast. It connects the Arabian Sea with the Anchuthengu backwaters through a man-made breakwater and entrance channel. The port and harbour complex enable the mechanised fishing fleet of the region to access deeper fishing grounds while providing protected berthing and landing infrastructure. The area also receives tourist attention due to its scenic breakwater, estuary and beach landscape. Navigation safety, sedimentation management and fisher safety have been active areas of infrastructure interventions by the state authorities.

current_activities.S: Marine fishing operations, landing and auction of fish, local tourism visits to the breakwater and estuary, operation of small backwater boats and use of the channel for community transport in the surrounding villages.

major_business.S: Marine fish and seafood products, local tourism services, ice and fishing supplies, and limited coastal boat movement linked to the backwaters.

L.S: Fishing boat berths and landing points
Access road and public promenade along the breakwater

description.S: Neeleswaram (Nileshwar) Port is a small coastal and backwater-linked facility in Kasaragod district, northern Kerala. Traditionally, it has served as a local landing point for fishing craft and country boats moving along the backwaters and nearshore waters of the Malabar coast. The port area is closely associated with coir, coconut and agricultural trade, as well as fishing and small-scale cargo. While it does not handle large commercial vessels, it plays an important connective role between coastal villages, local markets and inland waterways. The surrounding region is also prominent in tourism, with houseboat operations and beach tourism gradually integrating the waterways and coastline.

current_activities.S: Fishing, landing of small boats and canoes, local transport of agricultural produce and building materials by water, limited tourism-oriented boating and community-level marine services.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts and agriculture-linked cargo, coir-related products, small construction materials and local passenger or goods transport via boats.

L.S: Simple jetty and boat landing steps
Small storage sheds near the waterfront
Areas for net drying and gear storage
Access roads linking to town markets
Backwater channels suitable for country boats

description.S: Thalassery (Tellicherry) Port is a historical coastal port town on the Malabar Coast of Kerala, once a key centre for export of spices, coffee and timber under colonial trading companies. The physical port today functions at a modest scale with a focus on fishing, coastal craft and small marine cargo, but its historical importance remains high. The waterfront consists of old pier remnants, boat landing areas and fishing-related infrastructure. The port continues to support local fishers and minor coastal trade and is also integrated with heritage and tourism circuits highlighting colonial-era forts, lighthouses and cultural attractions around Thalassery.

current_activities.S: Fishing, beach landing of boats, localized marine cargo, small passenger boats, and tourism-related activity such as coastal sightseeing and visits to coastal fort structures.

major_business.S: Fish and seafood, limited coastal general cargo, tourism-linked services and small-scale boat-based trade.
