L.S: Boat landing sites along the rocky coast
Old pier remains used for small craft

description.S: Badagara, also known as Vatakara, is a minor coastal port town in Kozhikode district of Kerala. Historically, it participated in spice and coir trade along the Malabar Coast. Today, the functional port area is modest and oriented primarily towards fishing, small coastal boat traffic and landing of minor cargo. The town is associated with traditional martial art and folklore, adding cultural significance to the port vicinity. While it lacks large harbour infrastructure, the foreshore and small jetties facilitate day-to-day marine activities for local communities along this stretch of coastline.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations using country craft and mechanised boats, beach landing of vessels, local movement of goods such as coconuts and coir products, and limited tourism and recreational boating.

major_business.S: Fish and seafood, coir and coconut-related produce, local coastal goods, and small-scale trade items moving between nearby coastal settlements.

L.S: Boat landing points and simple jetties
Storage sheds for nets and cargo
Areas for fish drying and coir handling
Road access to Vatakara town markets
Basic navigation and safety structures on the shore

description.S: Kozhikode Old Port area, close to the iconic Calicut Beach, represents the remnants of one of US’s most storied maritime gateways, associated with the spice trade and the landing of European explorers. In contemporary times, the old pier and adjoining foreshore are used primarily by small fishing craft, local cargo boats and tourism-oriented activities, rather than regular deep-sea cargo ships. The port zone is embedded in an urban beachfront setting with promenades, fish markets and community infrastructure. Although its commercial port role has declined, it remains a culturally and economically relevant hub for local fishers and coastal businesses.

current_activities.S: Beach-based fishing operations, landing and sale of fish, leisure and tourist visits to the pier and beach, small-scale boat trips, and community-level marine trade and services.

major_business.S: Fish and seafood for local markets, small coastal goods, tourism services such as rides and food stalls, and related micro-businesses in the port neighbourhood.

L.S: Old pier structures used by local boats
Urban road connectivity to central Kozhikode

description.S: Kasaragod Port represents a cluster of small coastal landing points and jetties along the Arabian Sea frontage of Kasaragod district, in northern Kerala, used mainly by fishing communities and small coastal craft. Historically, the region saw limited coastal trade and movement of coconuts, arecanut and other produce. In present times the port usage is predominantly for artisanal and mechanised fishing operations, with ancillary economic activity such as ice supply, fish marketing, and marine services. The coastline around Kasaragod also contributes to tourism, which indirectly benefits from safe landing and mooring sites maintained for local boats.

current_activities.S: Fishing and fish landing at multiple beach landing centres, distribution of seafood to inland markets, minor coastal transport of goods, and local tourism activities along beaches served by small boats and catamarans.

major_business.S: Marine fish and seafood, dried fish, small coastal commodities and local tourism-related marine operations along the Kasaragod shoreline.

L.S: Multiple small jetties and beach landing sites
Basic fish landing and auction platforms
Ice plants and cold storage in the region
Storage sheds for nets and gear
Road access linking landing points to Kasaragod town

description.S: Puthiyappa Port is a well-known fishing and minor coastal port located north of Kozhikode city. Developed as an alternative to congested urban landing centers, the port supports a large mechanized fishing fleet, ice plants, cold storage units, auction halls and shore-based fisheries supply chains. Its protected breakwater and dredged channel offer safe berthing for boats, making it one of the busiest seafood landing points in northern Kerala. Though primarily fisheries oriented, the port handles limited coastal cargo and supports local marine trade. Its strategic location near Kozhikode enhances market access for seafood distribution throughout Kerala and Tamil Nadu.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, daily wholesale auctions, cold-chain operations, ice supply, boat maintenance, net-mending, and small quantities of coastal cargo including sand, building materials and minor goods.

major_business.S: Fresh fish, prawn, sardines, dried fish, ice and cold-chain logistics, fishing equipment and coastal cargo.

description.S: Kollam Fishing Harbour is one of Kerala’s largest and most active fish landing centers. It supports a major component of Kerala’s marine seafood sector with extensive landing platforms, deep-sea trawler fleets, processing units, ice factories and cold storage facilities. Positioned near Neendakara and Ashtamudi Lake, the harbour has significant roles in Kerala’s export-oriented seafood economy. Its infrastructure includes berthing facilities for hundreds of mechanized boats, fuel depots, net sheds and large auction halls. The harbour also functions as a key support point for fishermen migrating seasonally along the west coast.

current_activities.S: Heavy fishing landings, seafood auctions, processing, ice supply, cold-chain distribution, boat repair and limited coastal cargo linked to local markets.

major_business.S: Marine fish, shrimp, anchovies, sardines, seafood exports, ice production and wholesale distribution.

description.S: Vizhinjam Fishing Harbour lies adjacent to the newly constructed Vizhinjam International Seaport. It is a prominent fishing hub for southern Kerala, supporting thousands of fishers and a large volume of daily landings. The harbour has a well-defined breakwater, berthing for trawlers and traditional vessels, fuel supply, ice plants and auction halls. Though small in area, the harbour is extremely busy and plays a vital socio-economic role. Its proximity to deep waters ensures access to rich fishing grounds, enabling higher productivity for fishermen compared to other coastal areas.

current_activities.S: Deep-sea fishing, trawler landings, fish sorting, ice supply, auctions, boat maintenance and small coastal cargo associated with local markets.

major_business.S: Tuna, sardines, mackerel, shrimp, seafood processing and wholesale distribution.

description.S: Thottappally Port is located on the southern Kerala coast at the intersection of the Arabian Sea and the Thottappally spillway. It has historically served as a coastal cargo transit point and a fishing landing area. The port provides a maritime outlet for Alappuzha and nearby inland waterway systems, enabling movement of sand, building materials and agricultural produce. Thottappally's location near major backwater routes makes it important for intermodal transport and seasonal marine trade. Infrastructure includes small jetties, warehouse sheds and fish landing points.

current_activities.S: Fishing, coastal cargo movement of sand and agri-products, inland water transport, and seasonal small boat activities.

major_business.S: Fish, sand, coconut products, agricultural goods and limited coastal cargo.

description.S: Kayamkulam Port is positioned near the Kayamkulam Lagoon and serves as a minor coastal facility supporting fishing, inland navigation, and small cargo operations. The port plays a supporting role to local industries and agricultural communities. It provides a transition point between inland waterways and the Arabian Sea. The backwater network facilitates movement of coconuts, coir, rice and construction materials, and the coastal front supports fishing fleets. Development focus includes modernizing boat jetties and enhancing connectivity with traditional water transport corridors.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inland water cargo movement, small coastal shipping, passenger boat services and movement of agricultural goods.

major_business.S: Fish, coir products, coconuts, rice, building materials and local coastal cargo.

description.S: Azheekal Port in Alappuzha district is a coastal and backwater-linked minor port known for fishing and coastal cargo activity. The confluence of backwater channels and the Arabian Sea makes it a strategic landing point for boats operating along central Kerala. The port supports coconut and coir-based industries nearby and enables transport of local goods including sand, fish and agricultural commodities. Its narrow entrance channel and reef-protected coastal front provide natural shelter for small marine craft.

current_activities.S: Fishing, coastal cargo handling of coconuts and coir, movement of sand, backwater transport services and small passenger boat operations.

major_business.S: Marine fish, coir and coconut products, sand, local agri-products and coastal miscellaneous goods.

description.S: Mananthavadi Inland Water Port lies along the Kabini River system and historically acted as a waterborne trade route connecting Wayanad plateau to coastal Kerala. Today, it functions primarily as a community-level inland port facilitating boat movement, fishing, river transport of goods and tourism. Its significance lies in heritage water routes, eco-tourism and local trade in spices, timber and agricultural produce. The water depth restricts commercial boats, but the port is crucial for local connectivity and tourism projects.

current_activities.S: Fishing, local river transport, small cargo movement, tourism boating and traditional movement of agricultural produce along the river.

major_business.S: Fish, timber, spices, local agricultural products, tourism services and boat-based goods transport.

description.S: Chaliyam Port is a traditional coastal landing point located near the Chaliyar river mouth in Kozhikode district. Historically, it served as an early maritime hub for Malabar trade before larger ports like Beypore and Kozhikode modernized. Today, the port handles fishing craft, small cargo vessels and backwater boats. The surrounding Chaliyam region connects coastal and riverine transport routes, enabling movement of local goods. While not a commercial cargo port on a large scale, its role in supporting fishing communities and regional water transport remains important.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish landing, movement of coconuts and coir, riverine boat services, minor cargo movement of sand and building materials.

major_business.S: Fish, coir products, coconuts, river-transported cargo and coastal consumer goods.

description.S: Kannur Fishing Harbour lies near the historic port town of Kannur and serves as a major landing center for mechanized and traditional fishing vessels. Its sheltered harbour basin, breakwater, and landing platforms provide safe year-round berthing even during rough monsoon periods. The harbour is integrated into the seafood supply chain of northern Kerala, supplying major markets through cold-chain logistics. It also supports boat building, repair facilities and seasonal coastal migration of fishing fleets.

current_activities.S: Fishing, seafood auctions, ice supply, cold-chain distribution, boat repair, net mending and coastal transport.

major_business.S: Fresh fish, sardines, mackerel, prawn, dried fish products, ice and marine supplies.

description.S: Thikkodi Port is a small historic coastal landing point in Kozhikode district. Known for its lighthouse and scenic shoreline, the port today supports fishing and limited coastal trade. In earlier centuries, it handled spice and timber shipments along the Malabar coast. Although large-scale cargo no longer moves through Thikkodi, it remains important as a community port serving small boat operations, maritime livelihoods and tourism. The rock-protected coastline and calm nearshore waters provide natural berthing for fishing craft.

current_activities.S: Fishing, beach landing of boats, small-scale cargo movement, lighthouse tourism and community maritime activities.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, coir products, coastal goods and local marine services.

description.S: Vadakara Fishing Harbour is an active marine hub serving the northern Kerala coastline. It accommodates a large fleet of mechanized and traditional fishing vessels operating in the Arabian Sea. The harbour supports fish landing, wholesale auctions, ice plants, cold storage, and maintenance activities that sustain the local seafood economy. Vadakara's coastal geography and proximity to major fish markets in Kozhikode and Kannur allow efficient distribution of fresh marine products. The port is also used for community water transport, small coastal cargo movements, and seasonal fishing migrations.

current_activities.S: Daily fish landings, auctioning, ice and cold storage operations, seafood transport, repair of fishing vessels and limited coastal cargo movements.

major_business.S: Fresh fish, dried fish, marine products, ice distribution, fishing equipment and small-scale coastal cargo.

description.S: Minicoy Port lies within the lagoon of Minicoy Island, one of the southernmost islands of the Lakshadweep archipelago. The port serves as a lifeline for inter-island connectivity, fishing operations, passenger services and supply-chain logistics for the local population. Surrounded by coral reefs and crystal-clear waters, the port handles fishing vessels, cargo dhonis, and inter-island ferries. Due to its geographical isolation, the port plays a critical role in transporting essential commodities, construction materials, fuel and food supplies. It is also used by the Coast Guard and supports the region's expanding tourism sector.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island ferry services, supply-chain cargo, passenger transport, tourism boat operations and logistics support for essential goods.

major_business.S: Marine fish, tuna fisheries, inter-island cargo, tourism transportation and community logistics.

description.S: Agatti Port is a lagoon-based minor port on Agatti Island, serving as a crucial maritime gateway for tourism, local supply transport and the island’s fishing fleet. As Agatti hosts the only airstrip in Lakshadweep, the port supports multimodal logistics by distributing cargo received by air and inter-island vessels. Its clear-water lagoon, coral reef environment and growing tourism industry give the port additional importance. The port handles essential goods, construction materials, food supplies and fish landings for the island's residents.

current_activities.S: Fishing, supply transport, passenger boat operations, inter-island cargo distribution, tourism boats and essential goods unloading.

major_business.S: Fish, tuna, marine products, tourism logistics and inter-island supply chains.

description.S: Kavaratti Port serves the capital island of Lakshadweep and is one of the most important maritime nodes in the archipelago. Protected by coral reefs and located in a calm lagoon, the port manages inter-island ferries, cargo dhonis and fishing boats. It is essential for delivering food, fuel, construction materials and public utility items. The port area also supports tourism with glass-bottom boats, snorkeling trips and lagoon cruises. As the administrative hub, Kavaratti’s port infrastructure is constantly upgraded to support the population and government institutions.

current_activities.S: Passenger transport, inter-island cargo services, fishing, tourism boating and lagoon operations.

major_business.S: Marine fish, inter-island cargo, fuel supply, tourism services and essential goods distribution.

description.S: Androth Port is situated on one of the largest and most populous islands of Lakshadweep. Unlike other lagoon-based ports, Androth lacks a protected lagoon, so operations depend on weather windows and careful navigation. The port supports fishing activity, inter-island transport, essential goods supply and limited passenger services. Androth’s economy depends heavily on marine resources, coconut cultivation and fisheries logistics. Upgrades continue to improve safety, cargo handling and access for community transport.

current_activities.S: Fishing, passenger boat operations, inter-island supply delivery, small cargo movement and community transport.

major_business.S: Fish, coconut products, essential goods, marine logistics and inter-island cargo.

description.S: Kalpeni Port is located within the lagoon of Kalpeni Island and serves as a crucial transport and fishing hub. It enables movement of essential supplies, supports fishing fleets, and participates in inter-island connectivity. The island is known for its coral beaches and tourism potential, adding additional pressure on port infrastructure. Despite shallow waters, the lagoon provides safe anchorage for small boats and cargo dhonis. Its commercial relevance lies mainly in community support, fisheries logistics and passenger movement.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island cargo, passenger services, tourism boats and lagoon-based marine activity.

major_business.S: Tuna fishing, dried fish, essential commodities, tourism logistics and community cargo.

description.S: Kadmat Port is an important minor port serving Kadmat Island in the Lakshadweep archipelago. Known for its long, narrow island geography and rich marine biodiversity, Kadmat relies heavily on maritime transport for daily supplies, fuel, food and construction materials. Fishing is a major occupation, and the port serves as a landing point for tuna and reef-based fisheries. Tourism activity has increased in recent years due to water-sport attractions, and the port supports tourism logistics alongside essential cargo operations.

current_activities.S: Fishing, seafood logistics, inter-island transport, tourism boat operations, and freight delivery of essentials.

major_business.S: Tuna, reef fish, tourism logistics, community cargo and essential goods.

description.S: Kiltan Port, located on Kiltan Island in Lakshadweep, is a small coastal and lagoon-based facility essential for fishing and inter-island trade. The port enables transport of food, water, construction materials and public utility supplies. Fishing is the dominant occupation in Kiltan, and the port's role includes supporting tuna and reef fisheries. The island's remote location makes its port infrastructure vital for connectivity, survival logistics and limited tourism activity. Its lagoon offers protected anchorage for small boats.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island freight, essential goods supply, passenger boats and tourism services.

major_business.S: Tuna fisheries, seafood products, essential commodities, lagoon transport and tourism logistics.

description.S: Chetlat Port is a lagoon-based minor port servicing Chetlat Island in Lakshadweep. Historically known for coir weaving and marine trade, the island now relies heavily on the port for transportation of essential goods, inter-island cargo and fishing activities. Due to its isolation and exposure to oceanic conditions, the port operates mainly within the lagoon, where calm waters enable safe landings. The port also supports community travel and cultural maritime practices.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island cargo unloading, passenger movement, coir product transport and small tourism boat operations.

major_business.S: Coir products, tuna, fish, essential commodities and light coastal cargo.

description.S: Bitra Port serves Bitra Island, the smallest inhabited island of Lakshadweep. It mainly supports artisanal fishing, inter-island cargo transfer and community transport. Due to its tiny land area, limited population and ecological fragility, the port infrastructure is basic but essential for survival logistics. Fishing craft use the lagoon for landing, and supply boats deliver food, fuel, medical supplies and public utility goods. Tourism is minimal, and the port's activities are closely tied to the needs of the island population.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island cargo unloading, community transport services and delivery of essential goods.

major_business.S: Fish, coconut products, essential commodities, fuel supply and small-scale inter-island transport.

description.S: Amini Port serves Amini Island, known historically for its skilled coral stone masonry, coir production and tuna fishing. The port lies within the island’s lagoon, providing safe anchorage for local fishing vessels, inter-island ferries and cargo dhonis. Due to its isolation, Amini Port is vital for bringing essential supplies including rice, fuel, medicines and construction materials. Its operations also support the island’s coconut-based industries, fishery activities and growing small-scale tourism. Though modest in size, the port is central to community life, logistics and transport within the Lakshadweep archipelago.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, lagoon boating, inter-island passenger transport, delivery of essential goods, loading and unloading of cargo dhonis and limited tourism-based trips.

major_business.S: Tuna fisheries, coir products, copra, essential commodities, fuel, food supplies and inter-island cargo.

description.S: Bangaram Port lies on the uninhabited but tourist-permitted Bangaram Island, famous for turquoise lagoons and coral reefs. Although the island has no permanent civilian population, the port’s lagoon jetty supports tourist boats, supply vessels, Coast Guard craft and resort logistics. The port enables transport of food, fuel, building materials and essential supplies needed for tourism operations. It is a key maritime point for diving, snorkeling and lagoon tourism activities. The reef-protected basin offers extremely calm waters suitable for anchoring small craft.

current_activities.S: Tourist boat operations, supply-cargo unloading, inter-island launches, diving excursions, lagoon water-sport logistics and emergency response support.

major_business.S: Tourism logistics, food supplies, building materials, fuel, and limited fishing support.

description.S: Suheli Port serves Suheli Par, a sparsely inhabited lagoon island known for its rich coral reefs and traditional seasonal fishing camps. The lagoon allows anchorage for small boats that arrive during fishing seasons, especially for tuna pole-and-line expeditions. While not a commercial port in the typical sense, Suheli’s landing point is listed due to its maritime importance in Lakshadweep’s traditional fisheries. Supplies are brought from nearby islands, and the port acts as a temporary base for fishermen, Coast Guard patrols and eco-tourists during restricted seasons.

current_activities.S: Seasonal fishing, tuna expeditions, reef-based fishing operations, supply delivery from neighboring islands and occasional eco-tourism boat activity.

major_business.S: Tuna, reef fish, dried fish, fishing logistics and essential supplies for seasonal camps.

description.S: Cheriyam Port serves Cheriyam Island, part of the Amini group in Lakshadweep. Although uninhabited, the island is frequented by fishermen for seasonal stays. The port area is a lagoon landing site used by fishing vessels, emergency patrol boats and supply dhonis transporting water, food and equipment for fishing operations. Due to pristine beaches and untouched reefs, Cheriyam is also emerging as a restricted eco-tourism stopover. The port infrastructure is basic but essential during seasonal fishing peaks.

current_activities.S: Seasonal fishing landings, boat anchorage, supply operations, emergency patrol support and controlled tourism visits.

major_business.S: Tuna, reef fish, dried fish, fishing equipment and seasonal supply cargo.

description.S: Thoothukudi Old Port predates the modern V.O. Chidambaranar Port and historically handled bulk salt exports, general cargo and coastal trading vessels. The old harbour remains active as a minor port supporting regional salt trade, fishing operations, and coastal cargo movement. Its shallow draft limits large vessel entry, but numerous country craft, barges and small ships continue to use the wharf for intra-coastal movement. The port serves local traders, salt pan operators, and fishermen while supporting the broader maritime heritage of Thoothukudi.

current_activities.S: Salt export handling, coastal cargo operations, fishing activities, movement of small barges and support for local industries.

major_business.S: Salt, fertilizers, building materials, fish and coastal cargo.

description.S: Pamban Fishing Jetty serves the fishing fleet operating near Rameswaram and the Palk Strait. The jetty is strategically located close to the Pamban Bridge, making it an important marine logistics point for artisanal and mechanized fishers. In addition to fish landings, the port supports boat repair, auctioning, ice supply and the movement of fishing-related materials. Historically, Pamban served as a link between US and Sri Lanka’s ferry routes, and although commercial ferry services have not resumed, the fishing jetty remains a crucial coastal node.

current_activities.S: Landing of fish, auctions, ice supply, maintenance of fishing vessels, and daily movement of coastal fish to regional markets.

major_business.S: Marine fish, dried fish, fishing equipment supply, ice and small coastal goods.

description.S: Mandapam Port is located near the Palk Strait and functions primarily as a fishing and marine logistics facility. Historically, it played a significant role in trade between US and Sri Lanka. Today, Mandapam serves fisheries, coastal transport, marine research institutions and government marine patrol operations. The port’s location near shallow waters and coral patches limits large vessel entry but makes it ideal for artisanal and mechanized fishing activity. The region is also close to marine biodiversity hotspots and diving sites, giving the port additional ecological importance.

current_activities.S: Fishing operations, fish auctions, ice supply, boat maintenance, marine patrol support and limited coastal cargo handling.

major_business.S: Fish, dried fish, salt, marine supplies and coastal cargo.

description.S: Thondi Port is a historical coastal port located along the Palk Bay in Ramanathapuram District. It has long served as a fishing and local maritime trading point, facilitating the movement of fish, salt, coconuts and small-scale cargo. The shallow and calm waters make this port suitable for artisanal craft, while its proximity to Pamban and Ramanathapuram enhances its role in regional trade. The port is now primarily used by the fishing community and supports seasonal coastal traffic along the bay.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish drying, fish auctioning, coastal boat operations and movement of small cargo for local trade.

major_business.S: Fish, salt, coconuts, coir products and coastal goods.

description.S: Muttom Port is a coastal fishing and minor cargo node located in Kanyakumari district. Known for its lighthouse and rocky coastline, the port supports fishing operations, fish landing, ice supply and small marine trade. The port's history dates back to early colonial times when it handled coconut, coir and other coastal produce. While it no longer serves major cargo vessels, it remains essential for the local fishing community and tourism activities in the surrounding seaside region.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish landing, marine trade, tourist boat services, and coastal goods movement.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, coir, dried fish and small coastal cargo.

description.S: Manapad Port is a minor coastal port situated along the Gulf of Mannar in Tamil Nadu. Known for its unique coastal rock formations and Christian heritage sites, the port supports artisanal fisheries and seasonal coastal trade. Its natural cove offers anchorage for small boats. Historically, Manapad had trade links for pearls, fish and salt. Today, the port primarily supports fishing communities while also catering to tourism and cultural visitors. Efforts are underway to improve fishing facilities and coastal infrastructure.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish auctions, small-scale cargo movement, tourism boating and coastal community transport.

major_business.S: Fish, dried seafood, salt, coconuts and local coastal cargo.

description.S: Kulasekarapattinam Port, located along the Tiruchendur coast in Tamil Nadu, is a historical maritime settlement known for its proximity to ancient sea trade routes. Today, the port functions primarily as a fishing and coastal cargo centre supporting artisanal and mechanized fishing fleets. The region is also proposed as the location for US’s new ISRO small satellite launch port, which further increases the strategic significance of the coastline. The port facilitates movement of seafood, building materials, salt and coconut products. Though lacking deep-water infrastructure, Kulasekarapattinam remains an active node for coastal communities.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish auctions, ice supply, coastal trade of local goods, movement of coconuts, salt and construction materials, tourism visits and boat repair activities.

major_business.S: Fish, salt, coconuts, dried fish, coir-based goods and small-scale coastal cargo.

description.S: Kuthiraimozhi Port is a small coastal port in Thoothukudi district and part of the cluster of minor ports supporting the local fishing economy. Located close to the Gulf of Mannar coastline, the port has historically handled small vessels moving fish, coconuts and salt. The area is known for its calm shallow waters, allowing beach landing of boats. While commercial cargo use is minimal today, the port plays a vital role in sustaining local livelihoods through fishing-based trade and coastal logistics.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, drying, auctioning, small cargo transport, movement of salt and coconuts, and daily operations of coastal boats.

major_business.S: Fish, salt, coconuts, coir products and dried marine goods.

description.S: Manamelkudi Port, located on the southeastern coastline of Tamil Nadu, serves the fishing communities and small-scale coastal trade of Pudukottai district. It is one of the few functional coastal nodes in this stretch of shoreline, facilitating movement of fish, dried seafood, agricultural goods and salt. The region experiences moderate fishing intensity and seasonal fishing migration. Although infrastructure is basic, the port is crucial for local livelihoods and coastal connectivity.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish drying, auctions, coastal boat operations, transport of agri-goods, salt movement and small merchandise distribution.

major_business.S: Fish, dry fish, salt, coconuts, agricultural goods and coastal small cargo.

description.S: Muthupet Port lies near the extensive Muthupet mangrove forests of Tamil Nadu. It serves fishing communities and supports movement of fish, shrimps, salt, coconuts and local agricultural produce. Due to its proximity to the mangrove wetlands, the port is also linked to eco-sensitive zones and requires careful navigation by fishing craft. The region's backwater channels are used by small boats for transporting goods to nearby markets, making Muthupet an important water gateway for inland and coastal villages.

current_activities.S: Fishing, shrimp landing, movement of salt and coconuts, backwater boat transport, coastal cargo movement and fish drying operations.

major_business.S: Shrimp, fish, coconuts, salt, agricultural goods and coastal merchandise.

description.S: Thirupoondi Port lies along the deltaic coastline of the Cauvery river system and historically served as a landing point for fishing craft and coastal trade. The region’s shallow waters accommodate artisanal boats, which land fish, shrimp and local coastal commodities. The port also supports seasonal boat-based activities and movement of goods to nearby villages. While not a commercial cargo port, its role in sustaining the fishing economy and inter-village boat transport is significant.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, shrimp trade, coastal boat movement, backwater transport and movement of agricultural goods.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, coastal goods, coconuts, rice and dried marine produce.

description.S: Nagapattinam Fishing Harbour is a major fishing hub on the Tamil Nadu coast and supports a large fleet of mechanized trawlers and traditional craft. It is closely integrated with seafood exports, wholesale fish markets and ice plants in the region. The harbour plays an essential economic role for fishermen across Nagapattinam district, providing secure berthing, auction platforms, repair facilities and cold-chain support. Its proximity to the Bay of Bengal and long-standing maritime heritage add to its significance.

current_activities.S: Fishing, seafood landing, sorting, auctioning, ice production, cold storage services and boat repair operations.

major_business.S: Marine fish, shrimp, cuttlefish, tuna, ice supply and wholesale seafood distribution.

description.S: Killai Port is situated near the Killai backwaters in the Cuddalore district and forms part of the network of small coastal and riverine trading points along the region’s estuarine system. The port supports fishing communities and small-scale transport of goods such as firewood, coconuts and agricultural produce. Its calm backwaters allow safe berthing for country craft and artisanal vessels. Killai also connects to mangrove-rich Pichavaram, which enhances its relevance for eco-tourism and water-based transport.

current_activities.S: Fishing, backwater transport, small cargo movement, mangrove tourism, and seasonal boat operations.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, firewood, agricultural produce, backwater goods and small cargo items.

description.S: Pazhayar Port is located near the Kaveri river delta along the Nagapattinam–Sirkazhi coastal belt in Tamil Nadu. The port supports artisanal fishermen and small-scale coastal cargo movement. Pazhayar’s fish landing centre is known for its vibrant seafood trade, with fish transported to nearby towns and inland markets. The river-mouth environment creates a natural landing area, and the port acts as a hub for fishing fleets operating in the Bay of Bengal.

current_activities.S: Marine fishing, fish auctions, movement of agricultural produce, coastal cargo transport and drying of fish products.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, agricultural goods, salt and coastal trade materials.

description.S: Tharangambadi Fishing Landing Centre serves the active fishing community of the Tharangambadi coastline. While the area is historically significant due to Danish colonial heritage, the landing centre operates as a modern fisheries node with auction platforms, drying yards, and support facilities for coastal fishermen. The shallow coast allows artisanal boats to land with ease, contributing to steady fish production feeding local and regional markets. The region is known for sardines, mackerel and shrimp fisheries.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, local auctions, drying, ice supply, coastal boat operations and fisheries-based trade.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, dried seafood, ice, fishing equipment and coastal goods.

description.S: Vembar Port is a small coastal port located in Thoothukudi district. Known for its strong fishing community and scenic coastline, the port historically supported coastal trade in salt, coconuts and dried fish. Today, Vembar remains a vital fishing-based economy, with small boats frequently landing their catch on the sandy shoreline. Infrastructure is basic, but the port supports auctions, transportation and coastal movement of marine goods while preserving traditional fishing practices.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish auction, coastal cargo movement, net drying, boat maintenance and distribution of marine products to nearby markets.

major_business.S: Fish, dried seafood, coconuts, salt, coir products and local coastal cargo.

description.S: Kanyakumari Port is a symbolic and functional minor port located at US's southernmost tip where the Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal and USn Ocean meet. Historically used for coastal trade and movement of coconuts, coir and fish, the port today functions as a key fishing centre and tourism embarkation point. Passenger boats operate to the Vivekananda Rock Memorial and nearby attractions from this port. The unique geography and high tourist footfall add commercial and cultural value, while fishing operations continue to support coastal livelihoods.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish auctions, boat services to Vivekananda Rock, coastal cargo, tourism boating and limited inter-village transport.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, coir products, dried seafood, tourist transport services and coastal cargo.

description.S: Colachel Fishing Harbour supports a major fishing fleet operating along the Kanyakumari coastline. The harbour is equipped with landing platforms, fish sorting areas, ice plants, cold storage and facilities for repairing boats and nets. It is crucial for sustaining the seafood economy of the region and serves as a key landing point for tuna, sardines and mackerel. The port's sheltered waters and breakwaters ensure safe berthing for fishing vessels year-round despite the region's strong monsoon waves.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, seafood auctions, repair of fishing vessels, ice production, cold-chain logistics and distribution to major markets.

major_business.S: Marine fish, tuna, sardines, ice, dried fish products and coastal fishing supplies.

description.S: Rameswaram Port, located on the pilgrimage island of Rameswaram, is an important fishing and passenger port in Tamil Nadu. Historically active in Indo–Sri Lanka coastal trade, the port now primarily handles fishing vessels, tourist boats and supply cargo. Its sheltered coastline supports a large fishing community that depends on the port for auctions, boat maintenance and logistics. Rameswaram’s proximity to the Palk Strait allows access to productive fishing grounds and traditional maritime routes.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish landing, passenger boat services, local cargo movement, repair of boats and distribution of marine products.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, dried fish, coconuts, tourism boat services and local cargo.

description.S: Kodiyakarai Port (Point Calimere) is a minor port and coastal node situated at the southernmost edge of the Cauvery delta. The port has historical significance as a trading point for salt, fish and coastal goods. Today, it primarily supports artisanal fishing and seasonal trade of marine products. Located near wildlife sanctuaries and coastal wetlands, the port functions within an ecologically sensitive zone. Despite shallow waters, the port remains important for coastal communities and traditional fishing activities.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish drying, auctioning, movement of salt and coastal produce and boat transport for local communities.

major_business.S: Fish, salt, dried fish, coconuts, coir products and local cargo.

description.S: Pazhayar–Kollidam Port is an estuarine minor quay located near the Kollidam River mouth. Historically involved in the movement of salt, coconuts and agricultural produce, the port today functions mainly as a fishing landing centre. The area offers a natural river-mouth landing zone for boats, and coastal communities rely on the port for daily fishing-based commerce. Infrastructure developments focus on enhancing landing platforms, auction areas and fish drying yards.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish sorting, drying, auctions, coastal boat operation and transport of agricultural goods.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, dried fish, coconuts, rice and local goods.

description.S: Krishnapatnam Fishing Harbour lies adjacent to the large commercial Krishnapatnam Port but functions independently to support the fishing economy of Nellore district. It includes berthing for small fishing vessels, auction halls, ice plants and distribution points for fish transport. The harbour is essential for fishermen who operate in the Bay of Bengal waters close to the Andhra coast. Although overshadowed by the massive commercial port nearby, this fishing harbour has its own economic significance.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, auctioning, ice supply, boat maintenance and distribution of seafood to inland areas.

major_business.S: Fish, prawns, shrimp, dried seafood and marine supplies.

description.S: Bhairavapalem Port is located along the Godavari river estuary and is a minor river-sea interface port supporting fishing and local trade. The backwater-fed landing area enables fishers and small cargo boats to operate safely, and the port is vital for communities across Konaseema region. It supports the movement of fish, coconuts, betel nuts, agricultural produce and essential supplies into nearby villages. The port also links to traditional water transport routes across the delta.

current_activities.S: Fishing, backwater transport, coastal cargo, movement of agricultural goods, distribution of marine supplies and tourism boat operations.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, coconuts, agricultural produce and small-scale river-sea cargo.

description.S: Uppada Port is a fishing and coastal landing centre located near the Bay of Bengal coastline north of Kakinada. Known for its fishing fleets and seafood trading, Uppada also serves as a point of coastal cargo transfer involving materials like sand and coconuts. The port sustains local livelihoods and supports seafood distribution networks across East Godavari district. The beach landing environment requires regular dredging and shoreline maintenance due to strong wave action.

current_activities.S: Fishing, drying of fish, distribution to markets, coastal cargo movement and local transport of goods.

major_business.S: Fish, prawns, dried marine products, sand transport and coconut trade.

description.S: Rajayyapeta Port lies along the East Godavari coastline and serves as a traditional fishing and coastal trading point. The port supports beach-based boat landings and seasonal cargo movements. Communities surrounding Rajayyapeta rely heavily on fishing activities for their livelihoods, and the port facilitates auctions, drying, and distribution of marine goods. Although basic in infrastructure, the port plays an important socio-economic role for the region's fishing sector.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish landing, auctions, drying, coastal cargo movement and distribution to inland fish markets.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, dried fish, coconuts, small-scale trade goods and coastal produce.

description.S: Kakinada Anchorage Port is one of the oldest anchorage-style ports in Andhra Pradesh and predates the development of the modern deep-water Kakinada Port. It operates by lighterage, where cargo is transferred from mother vessels at deeper waters to barges for transport to shore. The port historically handled rice, peanuts, fertilizers and general cargo, playing a central role in coastal commerce. Though major cargo volumes have shifted to the deep-water port, the anchorage continues to support lighterage, fishing craft and small coastal trade.

current_activities.S: Lighterage for bulk cargo, fishing, small coastal trade, movement of rice, fertilizers and general goods and barge operations.

major_business.S: Rice, fertilizers, peanuts, agri-products, sand and coastal cargo.

description.S: Bheemunipatnam Fishing Harbour is part of the historic port town of Bheemunipatnam, which was once a Dutch trading hub on the Bay of Bengal. Today, the harbour functions as an important fisheries landing centre for Visakhapatnam district. It handles mechanized and artisanal fishing boats, daily seafood landings, cold chain operations and wholesale auctions. The harbour’s coastal geography allows access to rich fishing grounds, making it economically critical for local fishermen. Efforts continue to modernize landing facilities, improve storage infrastructure and support coastal livelihoods.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, auctions, ice and cold storage operations, distribution of seafood to nearby towns, repair of fishing boats and net maintenance.

major_business.S: Fish, prawns, dried marine goods, fishing equipment, ice and cold chain services.

description.S: Visakhapatnam Old Anchorage is one of the earliest maritime points in Vizag’s coastal history. Before the development of the deep-water port, cargo was transferred here using lighterage vessels. Although its commercial role has diminished, it continues to support fishing boats, small cargo craft and coastal operations. The anchorage remains significant as a heritage maritime location and a support point for smaller vessels operating near the coastline.

current_activities.S: Fishing, support for small boats, limited coastal cargo movement, community-based maritime activities and pilot operations.

major_business.S: Fish, small general cargo, boat supplies and marine services.

description.S: Kalingapatnam Fishing Harbour lies along the north Andhra coastline and supports a large fleet of fishing vessels operating in the Bay of Bengal. It is one of the most productive seafood landing points in Srikakulam district. Historically used for Indo–Southeast Asian maritime trade, Kalingapatnam has evolved into a modern fisheries hub with drying yards, cold chain units and auction platforms. The harbour's socio-economic importance is high due to its contribution to employment and regional seafood distribution.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, shrimp trade, drying of marine products, ice supply, boat repair and regional seafood distribution.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, cuttlefish, dried fish, fishing supplies and local cargo.

description.S: Baruva Port is a coastal minor port located near the confluence of the Mahendratanaya River and the Bay of Bengal. Once active in jute and agricultural trade during colonial times, it now functions mainly as a fishing and coastal landing centre. Baruva is known for its scenic beach, lighthouse and memorial dedicated to historical shipwrecks. Though not a major cargo hub today, it serves local fishermen and supports seasonal coastal trade.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish drying, coastal cargo movement, boat landing and community-level maritime activities.

major_business.S: Fish, dried fish, coconuts, salt and small coastal produce.

description.S: Bahuda River Mouth Port lies on the southern Odisha coastline near the Andhra border. The port has traditionally supported artisanal fishing, river-sea transport and small-scale cargo movement. Seasonal fishing camps, shrimp landing sites and coastal trade in salt and agricultural products highlight its economic patterns. The river mouth provides a sheltered landing location for small craft, making the port vital for local communities dependent on marine resources.

current_activities.S: Fishing, shrimp landing, river-sea cargo movement, seasonal boat operations and distribution of marine goods.

major_business.S: Shrimp, fish, salt, coconuts, agricultural goods and coastal small cargo.

description.S: Gopalpur Fishing Port operates alongside the nearby commercial Gopalpur Port. It is a busy landing centre for mechanized boats and trawlers operating in Odisha’s southern coastal waters. The port supports seafood auctions, ice production, storage, processing and distribution to major markets in Odisha and Andhra Pradesh. Fishing communities from multiple nearby villages rely on the port for daily economic activity. The harbour area has recently undergone upgrades to improve landing infrastructure and sanitation facilities.

current_activities.S: Fish landing, sorting, ice supply, seafood distribution, cold-chain operations and boat maintenance.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, cuttlefish, dried marine goods and fisheries supplies.

description.S: Devi River Port lies near the mouth of the Devi River in Puri district of Odisha. Historically, the port supported coastal trade and fishing, and the region remains active with artisanal fishing communities. The river mouth offers a natural landing zone protected from open-sea conditions. While commercial cargo is minimal today, the port is important due to ongoing proposals for a new deep-water port development in its vicinity. The traditional fishing economy remains central to the port’s functioning.

current_activities.S: Fishing, shrimp landing, river-sea boat transport, small cargo movement and fish drying operations.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, dried seafood, coconuts and small local cargo.

description.S: Subarnarekha Mouth Port is located at the estuary of the Subarnarekha River near the Odisha–West Bengal border. It is an active fishing landing point supporting local communities in northern Odisha. Its geographical location offers access to both riverine channels and the Bay of Bengal. Historically, the area supported trade in salt, rice and coastal goods. Today, it remains a key fisheries hub and seasonal anchoring point for small boats. The port is included in Odisha’s official list of notified minor ports.

current_activities.S: Fishing, shrimp landing, small cargo movement, seasonal fishing camps and limited coastal transport.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, dried seafood, agricultural goods and coastal products.

description.S: Talasari Port is a minor fishing and tourist landing centre situated near the Odisha–West Bengal border close to Digha. Known for its scenic beach, red crabs and tranquil coastline, Talasari supports fishing activities, small boat transport, seafood trade and tourism boating. Though not a commercial cargo port, it functions as a community port supporting artisanal fishing and small-scale movement of coastal goods.

current_activities.S: Fishing, tourism boat rides, seafood trade, small-scale cargo movement and beachside marine activity.

major_business.S: Fish, crabs, dried marine products, coconuts and tourism services.

description.S: Henry’s Island Port is a minor coastal facility located near Bakkhali in South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal. Known for its mangrove forests, wildlife and salt pans, the port is primarily used for fishing, small-scale marine transport and eco-tourism activities. The sheltered coast allows small boats to operate safely. Fishers use the port for daily landings, while tourist boats operate seasonally. The port is part of West Bengal’s registered minor ports list with community-level economic importance.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish landing, tourism boating, small marine cargo movement and mangrove-linked eco-tourism operations.

major_business.S: Fish, crabs, coastal goods, salt, coconuts and tourism services.

description.S: Namkhana Port is a coastal minor port situated near the Hatania–Doania River in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal. Traditionally used as a fishing and small-cargo landing point, it also serves as a gateway to Sagar Island and the Sundarbans region. Its strategic backwater connectivity and sheltered waterways make Namkhana an important maritime node for local communities. The port supports fishing fleets, inter-island boat services, goods transport and movement of agricultural produce. The region is also known for eco-tourism and ferry services related to Sagar Island pilgrimages.

current_activities.S: Fishing, river-sea cargo movement, ferry services, inter-island transport, fish auctioning and agricultural produce movement.

major_business.S: Fish, crabs, agricultural goods, rice, coconuts, local cargo and tourism transport.

description.S: Diamond Harbour Port is located on the eastern bank of the Hooghly River, south of Kolkata. Historically, it acted as an important anchorage point for vessels approaching the Kolkata Port. Today, it functions as a minor port supporting fishing fleets, river cargo movement, ferries and Coast Guard operations. Its proximity to Kolkata and the deep navigational channel of the Hooghly makes it suitable for barge operations, lighterage cargo and small coastal vessels. It remains strategically significant in riverine logistics and maritime security.

current_activities.S: Fishing, river cargo, barge operations, ferry transport, Coast Guard activities and small-scale marine services.

major_business.S: Fish, river cargo, sand, bricks, agricultural goods and marine supplies.

description.S: Kulpi Port is a notified minor port located on the bank of the Hooghly River. It is envisioned as a future cargo-handling hub due to its proximity to the deep navigational channel of the estuary. Currently, the region supports barge operations, fishing activities and riverine transport of local goods. The port’s strategic location within West Bengal’s proposed maritime industrial zone has attracted interest for future expansion plans. For now, it serves as a community-level maritime point assisting coastal villages and river-based trade operations.

current_activities.S: Fishing, river cargo movement, movement of building materials, small barge operations and community transport.

major_business.S: Fish, sand, bricks, agricultural goods and river-based cargo.

description.S: Haldia Fishing Port is one of the major seafood landing hubs in the Hooghly estuary region. Located near the industrial complex of Haldia, the port plays a dual role by supporting both the fishing sector and supplying marine products to industrial canteens and urban markets. The harbour has a large daily landing volume and supports ice plants, cold storage units, processing facilities and auction areas. It forms an important part of the fishing economy of Purba Medinipur district.

current_activities.S: Fishing, fish auctions, ice supply, cold storage, boat maintenance, processing and distribution to Kolkata and Haldia markets.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, crabs, dried marine products and cold-chain seafood.

description.S: Sagar Island Port is located at the mouth of the Hooghly River and is part of a key maritime zone associated with pilgrimages and fishing activities. It serves as a landing point for fishing boats, ferries and small coastal vessels. The port is vital during the annual Gangasagar Mela, when thousands of boats ferry pilgrims across the estuary. It also handles seasonal cargo movement and supports the livelihoods of local fishing communities. Its strategic estuarine location will play a role in future port development initiatives in West Bengal.

current_activities.S: Fishing, ferry services, fish auctions, coastal cargo movement, and large-scale passenger transport during religious events.

major_business.S: Fish, crabs, local goods, passenger transport, coastal materials and tourism services.

description.S: Dadanpatrabar Port lies along the coastal belt near Tajpur and Mandarmani. This minor port is primarily used for fishing, coastal boat operations and seasonal marine tourism. The shallow waters make it suitable for artisanal craft, and the region has been a developing tourism hotspot. Although not used for major cargo today, the port contributes to local commerce through fishing activities and coastal tourism services such as boat rides and beach excursions.

current_activities.S: Fishing, tourism boating, small coastal goods transport and community fishing operations.

major_business.S: Fish, crabs, dried seafood, coconut-based goods and tourism services.

description.S: Tajpur Port is a fishing and coastal landing point located near the popular Tajpur Beach along the Bay of Bengal. The port supports artisanal and mechanized fishermen, seasonal tourism boating and small-scale movement of coastal goods. While the region is being considered for development of a major deep-sea port in the future, the current minor port continues to serve local communities by facilitating fish landings, trade in coastal produce and marine-related tourism.

current_activities.S: Fishing, tourism boating, beach landing of craft, small cargo movement and fish drying.

major_business.S: Fish, shrimp, crabs, coconuts, coastal goods and tourism services.

description.S: Junput Port is a minor coastal landing point located near Digha and Mandarmani. Known for its serene beaches and developing tourism sector, the port operates primarily as a fishing and community marine logistics point. Its shallow coastline and tidal patterns support artisanal craft and seasonal fishing fleets. Although small in scale, the port contributes to the regional seafood economy and serves local transportation needs.

current_activities.S: Fishing, beach landings, seafood trade, small cargo movement and marine tourism services.

major_business.S: Fish, crabs, dried seafood, coconuts and beach tourism services.

description.S: Narayanpur Port functions as a small riverine and coastal landing point along the Hooghly estuary. The port is used mainly for fishing and movement of local cargo such as sand, bricks and agricultural produce. While lacking major cargo infrastructure, Narayanpur plays a vital role in connecting coastal villages with nearby markets. It also supports seasonal tourism and boat services along the river.

current_activities.S: Fishing, river-sea cargo, passenger boat services, local trade in agricultural goods and coastal materials.

major_business.S: Fish, sand, bricks, agricultural produce and small river cargo.

description.S: Kakdwip Port is an important coastal port and ferry junction in the South 24 Parganas district of West Bengal. It provides connectivity to Sagar Island and other riverine settlements through daily ferry services. The port also handles fishing operations, small cargo movement and river-based trade. Its strategic location on the Hooghly estuary makes it a vital link for both community transport and fisheries-based commerce in the Sundarbans belt.

current_activities.S: Ferry services, fishing, fish landing, river cargo movement, distribution of coastal goods and regional transport.

major_business.S: Fish, passenger services, agricultural goods, river sand and coastal small cargo.

description.S: Port Blair Minor Anchorage functions as a secondary maritime facility complementing the main Port Blair harbour. It is used by fishing vessels, inter-island cargo boats, private ferries, coast-based supply carriers and local marine traders. Historically, this anchorage supported the early colonial port operations before large berths were constructed. The sheltered geography of the Andaman Sea provides calm waters year-round, making the anchorage suitable for fishing fleets, tourism boats and community-level logistics. It continues to play a key support role for marine transport within the island group.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island transport, tourism boat services, small cargo movement, marine repair and passenger movement to nearby islands.

major_business.S: Fish, tourism logistics, fuel supply, inter-island cargo and essential commodities.

description.S: Rangat Port is one of the key inter-island transport hubs located in Middle Andaman. The port serves passenger ferries, cargo vessels, fishing boats and small tourist craft. Its strategic central location makes it a transit point between northern and southern islands. The port is crucial for moving agricultural produce, coconuts, timber products, fuel, food supplies and construction materials to remote communities. Fishing is significant in this region, and the port supports daily landings and distribution to local markets.

current_activities.S: Passenger ferry movement, cargo loading, fishing, seafood distribution, fuel supply and inter-island logistics.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, timber, agricultural produce, essential supplies and passenger transport.

description.S: Mayabunder Port, located in North & Middle Andaman, serves as a major inter-island connectivity hub for passenger ferries, cargo ships and fishing boats. Its naturally sheltered harbour provides safe anchorage during monsoon seasons. The port plays a vital role in supplying remote islands with fuel, food, building materials and public utility goods. Mayabunder’s fishing communities rely heavily on the port’s landing facilities, cold storage and auction platforms. The port also supports tourism thanks to nearby scenic beaches and mangrove reserves.

current_activities.S: Passenger ferry operations, cargo handling, fishing landings, cold storage operations, tourism boat services and marine repair.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, timber, essential commodities, tourism logistics and inter-island cargo.

description.S: Diglipur Port is the northernmost significant port in the Andaman Islands. It serves as a lifeline for communities living in and around Diglipur, providing connectivity to Port Blair and other islands. The port handles inter-island vessels, cargo barges, fishing boats and passenger ferries. Agriculture, fisheries and tourism depend heavily on this port for logistics and supply-chain support. The harbour is surrounded by scenic coastlines, mangrove systems and trekking attractions, adding tourism relevance to its maritime operations.

current_activities.S: Cargo transport, fishing landings, ferry operations, cold storage logistics, tourism boat trips and essential goods supply.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, fruit, vegetables, fuel, construction materials and tourism services.

description.S: Hut Bay Port is the principal maritime gateway to Little Andaman Island. It handles passenger ferries, roll-on roll-off vessels, cargo ships and fishing boats. The port is crucial for transporting essential items such as fuel, grains, construction materials and public utility equipment. It also supports a thriving fishing sector and facilitates tourism activities including surfing, trekking and eco-tourism. Despite its remote location, Hut Bay Port maintains strong logistical importance for the island’s residents.

current_activities.S: Cargo loading, passenger movement, fishing operations, cold storage use, supply-chain logistics and tourism boat activities.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, agricultural goods, essential supplies, tourism logistics and construction materials.

description.S: Campbell Bay Port is the southernmost functional port in US, located on Great Nicobar Island. As a critical logistics point for the region, the port handles cargo ships, passenger ferries, Coast Guard vessels and fishing boats. The local economy is dependent on supplies brought by sea, including food, construction materials, fuel and essential household items. The port also supports strategic maritime activities due to its proximity to international shipping lanes and the Indira Point lighthouse.

current_activities.S: Cargo transport, fishing, inter-island connectivity, fuel supply operations, Coast Guard activities and essential goods movement.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, timber, essential supplies, fuel and logistics cargo.

description.S: Car Nicobar Port serves the tribal-majority island of Car Nicobar and is essential for transporting goods, fuel, food supplies and people. The port operates passenger ferries, cargo vessels and fishing boats. The island's economy revolves around coconut cultivation and fishing, both of which rely on maritime transport. The port is also used by government agencies and plays a critical emergency role during monsoons and natural disasters.

current_activities.S: Cargo unloading, passenger ferries, fishing, coconut trade and community marine transport.

major_business.S: Coconuts, fish, essential commodities, diesel supply and inter-island cargo.

description.S: Kamorta Port serves Kamorta Island and nearby tribal villages of Nancowry tehsil. The port handles passenger ferries, fishing boats, government supply vessels and inter-island cargo crafts. Kamorta relies heavily on maritime supply chains for daily necessities. The port also assists in the transportation of coconuts, fish, timber and essential public service materials. Marine patrol operations rely on this port due to the region’s strategic importance.

current_activities.S: Passenger movement, fishing, supply delivery, timber trade, essential cargo movement and maintenance of local boats.

major_business.S: Coconuts, fish, fuel, timber, general cargo and essential utilities.

description.S: Chowra Port serves the small tribal island of Chowra in the Nicobar group. The port is vital for transportation of coconuts, fish, firewood and household materials. Given the island’s remote location, the port is the only link for supply boats and inter-island passenger movement. The local communities depend on maritime trade for survival, and the port acts as a multifunctional lifeline for logistics, fishing and goods distribution.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island transport, supply unloading, coconut trade and movement of survival goods.

major_business.S: Coconuts, fish, tribal handicrafts, essential goods and timber items.

description.S: Teressa Port serves the remote tribal island of Teressa in the Nicobar district. The port facilitates the transportation of essential supplies, food, fuel and building materials. Fishing, handicrafts and coconuts form the mainstay of the island’s economy. Due to limited infrastructure and exposure to rough seas, the port operates primarily in protected coastal areas where small boats can land safely. Despite challenges, Teressa Port is vital for passenger travel, community welfare and inter-island trade.

current_activities.S: Fishing, passenger boat operations, cargo unloading, distribution of essential commodities and inter-island transport.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, handicrafts, general cargo and essential goods.

description.S: Katchal Port serves the remote island of Katchal in the Nicobar group, historically inhabited by tribal communities. The port acts as the primary connection point for the island’s supply chain, ensuring transport of food grains, fuel, medicines, construction materials and daily necessities. Fishing is a major livelihood, and the port facilitates fish landings, drying operations and inter-island seafood distribution. Due to isolation, the port is essential for movement of people, government goods, Coast Guard visits and disaster relief logistics.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island passenger transport, supply unloading, distribution of essential commodities, marine repair and occasional tourism movement.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, dried seafood, handicrafts, essential goods and public utility cargo.

description.S: Trinket Port lies on the small tribal island of Trinket, part of the Nancowry group in the Nicobar district. The port is primarily used for inter-island ferrying of essential supplies and supports fishing activities that form the economic backbone of the island’s tribal communities. Due to extremely limited landmass and sensitive ecology, the port infrastructure is minimal. Nonetheless, Trinket Port is vital for connectivity, healthcare logistics, emergency evacuations and sustenance-level trade.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island ferrying, supply unloading, small cargo distribution and community passenger movement.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, essential commodities and tribal goods.

description.S: Nancowry Port is one of the major minor ports serving the Nancowry tribal region. It provides a deep natural harbour, making it one of the safest and most important ports in the Nicobar Islands. The port regularly receives inter-island cargo vessels carrying food grains, fuel, building materials and medical supplies. The harbour also supports fishing fleets, government patrol vessels and passenger ferries. Due to its central location among the Nicobar group, Nancowry is a key logistical hub for both civilian and administrative operations.

current_activities.S: Cargo handling, fishing landings, inter-island passenger transport, marine fuel distribution and support for tribal community logistics.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, essential commodities, fuel supply, timber and inter-island cargo.

description.S: Katchal East Bay Port is a secondary landing point on Katchal Island, used mainly by the fishing community and small cargo carriers. It provides shallow anchorage and a natural landing slope that is utilized for unloading boats. Due to monsoon exposure at the western side of Katchal, East Bay serves as an alternative safe site during rough seas. Its utility lies in community-level logistics and fishing-based livelihood support.

current_activities.S: Fishing, unloading of essential goods, movement of coconuts and timber, and limited passenger boat traffic.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, timber items, general supplies and community cargo.

description.S: Champin Port is a minor landing point on Kamorta Island used extensively by local Nicobarese villagers for fishing and inter-island trade. It acts as a supplement to the primary Kamorta Port and serves settlements on the eastern side of the island. Fishing boats use this port due to its proximity to productive marine zones and safer landing conditions. Supply boats also anchor here for distributing community necessities.

current_activities.S: Fishing, supply unloading, transport of coconuts, inter-island boat movement and distribution of village-level cargo.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, general cargo, tribal goods and essential supplies.

description.S: Great Nicobar East Port serves the eastern coast of Great Nicobar Island and functions as a supplementary landing location to Campbell Bay. The port is used by fishing fleets, supply dhonis, passenger boats and government patrol vessels. It handles limited cargo operations and seasonal fishing activity. Given the island’s sparse population and strategic importance, the port supports logistical needs for local settlements and defense-linked movement.

current_activities.S: Fishing, supply unloading, inter-island passenger services, fuel transport and limited coastal trade.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, construction materials, essential supplies and coastal goods.

description.S: Harminder Bay Port is a key inter-island port on the southwestern coast of Little Andaman. It functions as a vital supply node for timber, coconuts, fish and essential commodities. The bay provides natural shelter for boats, making it suitable for fishing fleets and small inter-island cargo carriers. The port supports local tribal communities and is also used for tourism boat trips exploring nearby beaches, forests and waterfalls. Seasonal monsoon conditions influence port activity.

current_activities.S: Fishing, cargo unloading, inter-island transport, timber movement, tourism boating and community supply operations.

major_business.S: Timber, coconuts, fish, general supplies, agricultural goods and tourism services.

description.S: Chidiyatapu Port is a small but important coastal landing point located at the southernmost tip of South Andaman Island. Surrounded by lush forests, beaches and bird habitats, the port supports fishing activity, tourism boating and local supply transport. The calm bay area allows safe operation of small boats and is used by local fishermen as a primary landing site. The port aids in connecting nearby villages with Port Blair for essential trade and transport.

current_activities.S: Fishing, local passenger movement, transport of goods, tourism boats and coastal marine services.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, agricultural produce, tourism logistics and local cargo.

description.S: Neil Island Port serves the popular tourist island of Shaheed Dweep, connecting it with Port Blair and Havelock Island. The port handles passenger ferries, cargo vessels and fishing boats. Tourism is the main economic activity, and the port facilitates logistics for hotels, resorts and restaurants. In addition, fishing communities depend on the port for daily landings and supply transport. Calm lagoon conditions make the port suitable for small boats and water sports.

current_activities.S: Passenger ferries, cargo movement, fishing, tourism transport and supply-chain logistics for resorts.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, tourism goods, general cargo and agricultural produce.

description.S: Havelock Island Port is one of the busiest inter-island passenger and cargo ports in the Andaman group, serving the tourism-driven economy of Swaraj Dweep. Ferries arrive daily carrying tourists, residents and essential supplies from Port Blair and other islands. The port supports water sports operators, fishing boats and supply-chain logistics for hotels and businesses. Due to Havelock’s status as a major tourist destination, the port plays a critical role in economic sustainability.

current_activities.S: Passenger ferry handling, cargo unloading, tourism logistics, fishing operations, water sports vessel support and supply-chain distribution.

major_business.S: Tourism goods, fish, coconuts, food supplies, fuel and general cargo.

description.S: Long Island Port is a major inter-island connection point in Middle Andaman, supporting both passenger and cargo vessels. It plays an important economic role for nearby settlements and forest-based communities. The port handles timber, coconuts, fish, essential commodities and construction materials. Tourism has also expanded in recent years with the island’s pristine beaches, mangroves and marine attractions. The port’s sheltered bay provides safe anchorage, making it suitable for fishing fleets and smaller cargo crafts.

current_activities.S: Passenger ferry handling, cargo movement, fishing, timber loading, tourism boating and supply-chain distribution.

major_business.S: Fish, timber, coconuts, essential goods, inter-island cargo and tourism services.

description.S: Baratang Port serves Baratang Island, known for mangroves, limestone caves and tribal settlements. The port is a vital link for the movement of passengers, goods and vehicles between Middle and South Andaman. It handles ferries, cargo boats and fishing vessels. The port supports eco-tourism activities and also plays an important role in moving construction materials and essential commodities to the island’s communities.

current_activities.S: Passenger ferries, cargo handling, transport of vehicles, fishing operations, tourism boat services and supply delivery.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, timber, agricultural goods, tourism logistics and essential cargo.

description.S: Kadamtala Port is a small but crucial harbour located on the western coast of Middle Andaman Island. The port supports the movement of timber, coconuts, agricultural products and essential commodities. Fishing communities rely on this port for daily landings, auctions and transporting fish to inland markets. It serves fishing fleets, local inter-island traffic, cargo carriers and community boats. The port also plays a role in forest-based industries operating nearby.

current_activities.S: Fishing, cargo movement, timber handling, inter-island ferry operations and marine repair services.

major_business.S: Fish, timber, coconuts, agricultural produce, general cargo and local supplies.

description.S: Keralapuram Port is a notified minor port in North Andaman used primarily for fishing and local cargo handling. It supports the region’s coconut plantations, agricultural activity and fisheries sector. The port provides a landing site for boats, distribution of essential supplies and inter-village transport. Given the remote village clusters, the port plays a significant socio-economic role by connecting communities to larger markets and administrative centers.

current_activities.S: Fishing, movement of coconuts and agricultural produce, inter-village boating, transport of essential goods and minor cargo traffic.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, vegetables, timber products and general goods.

description.S: Kishorinagar Port is an important minor port serving the far northern region of North Andaman Island. It provides a landing point for fishing boats and cargo carriers that transport essential commodities. Due to the remote geography, the port is crucial for movement of food, fuel, school supplies, medical items and community requirements. It also supports seasonal tourism to nearby beaches and natural attractions.

current_activities.S: Fishing, unloading of supplies, inter-island cargo transport, distribution of essentials and tourism boat services.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, timber items, village goods, essential commodities and tourism logistics.

description.S: Aerial Bay Port serves the Diglipur region and supports fishing boats, passenger ferries and small cargo carriers. The bay’s geographical layout offers natural protection against rough seas, enabling safe operation of fishing fleets. The port is essential for transporting perishable goods, including fruits and vegetables produced locally. It also supports eco-tourism activities due to its proximity to Saddle Peak National Park.

current_activities.S: Fishing, local cargo unloading, inter-island ferries, tourism boats, cold-chain logistics and marine repair work.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, bananas, timber, essential goods and tourist cargo.

description.S: Sitapur Port is located in southern Little Andaman and serves as a secondary landing point for fishing fleets and cargo boats. It supports indigenous communities and local villages by enabling the transport of essential goods, fishing equipment and agricultural produce. The port area is also connected to scenic beaches and tourism spots, making it a multifunctional marine point. Although small in infrastructure, its role in local livelihoods is highly significant.

current_activities.S: Fishing, local supply movement, inter-island boat traffic, small cargo distribution and tourism boating.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, agricultural goods, essential supplies and tourist items.

description.S: Kalighat Port is a coastal and riverine landing point in North Andaman supporting both fishing and inter-island connectivity. The port serves remote villages with limited road access, making maritime transport crucial. Fishing communities rely on the port for landing their daily catch, auctions, ice supply and distribution. The port also supports government supply vessels, local ferries and tourism boats operating to nearby mangrove and forest attractions.

current_activities.S: Fishing, inter-island supply movement, passenger transport, seafood distribution and local cargo handling.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, agricultural goods, essential cargo and coastal materials.

description.S: Rutland Island Port supports the small population living on the island and acts as a landing point for fishing boats, tourism crafts and supply vessels. The island is known for diving spots, coral reefs and forests. The port enables movement of essential goods, fish landings and transportation of equipment for diving and eco-tourism operators. Its sheltered coastal topography allows safe boating year-round.

current_activities.S: Fishing, small cargo transport, tourism boat operations, diving logistics and supply movement.

major_business.S: Fish, coconuts, tourism items, diving supplies and general cargo.

description.S: Ross Island Port (now known as Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose Island Port) supports tourism and government movement between Port Blair and this historically significant island.
